== Welcome message ==
Hello, and '''[[Wikibooks:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]]''' to [[Wikibooks]]!
Here are some tips to [[Help|help]] you get started: * To learn the wiki-markup-language syntax, see [[Help:Editing]]. * Make sure to sign your posts and comments with four tildes, like this: ~~~~ **There is a box at the top of the edit window (if javascript is enabled on your browser) that will insert it too (looks like part of a signature). This will let others know who left it, and make it easy to reply back to you. * Remember to conduct any editing experiments in the [[Wikibooks:Sandbox|sandbox]]. * You can tell the community something about yourself in your userpage. ** You can get to this page by clicking the tab at the top of the page labeled with your registered username. * Wikibooks is a collection of open-source textbooks. ([[WB:WIW|What is Wikibooks]]). * If you are a '''Wikipedian''', see [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikipedians]] for a primer on how things work here (it's a little different). ** If you want to base your work here on materials from Wikipedia, please use [[WB:RFI]] (requests for importation) to bring the material over in compliance with the GFDL. * If you're an '''instructor''' and plan on using Wikibooks for a class project, see [[Wikibooks:Guidelines for class projects]] * Please say hello at the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading Room]] with any questions or ideas. * Eventually, you might want to read the [[Wikibooks:Manual of Style|Manual of Style]] and [[Wikibooks:Policies and guidelines|Policies and Guidelines]]. ** Help us by participating in policy and guideline creation. ** Please take a look at [[Wikibooks:Naming policy]] before starting a new book. * Remember to maintain a [[Wikibooks:Neutral point of view|Neutral point of view]]. * Explore, [[Wikibooks:Be bold in updating pages|be bold in editing pages]], and have fun!
You will find more resources in [[Wikibooks:Community Portal|Community Portal]]. If you want to ask a question, visit the [[Wikibooks:Study help desk|Study help desk]], the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading Room]], [[Wikibooks:IRC channels|IRC channel]] or [[User_talk:Panic2k4|ask me personally on my talk page]]. For site news, see the [[WB:BB|Bulletin board]]. It might be a good idea to add that page to your "[[Special:Watchlist|watchlist]]" so that you can see when any new information is posted there. You can do that by clicking the tab labeled "watch" at the top of the page.
Good luck! --[[User:Panic2k4|Panic]] ([[User talk:Panic2k4|talk]]) 15:46, 13 October 2008 (UTC)

Protein studies involves various step of sample preparation. The main protocols of protein studies are as followed: # Protein Synthesis # Purification # Evaluation of purified protein # Determination of Amino Acid Sequence # Calculation of Protein's Mass # Determination of Protein's 3-D Structure
There are many methods used to study proteins, including its shape and structure. For instance, X-Ray crystallography is used to give scientists the structure of the protein. Such information is used extensively in determining the characteristics of the protein as well as how it functions and under which circumstances. Other methods used includes amino acid sequencing, fluorescence microscopy, mass spectrometry, NMR, etc.
=Carbohydrate-Binding Proteins= Carbohydrate-Binding proteins (CBPs) are identified as important mediators for numerous different types of cellular events through interactions between carbohydrates and proteins. There are three main families of CBPs. # the C-type lectin family (including the Selectins) # the Siglec family # the galectin family
==C-type Lectins (including Selectins)== C-type Lectins and selectins are present in humans and murines (household rats and mice). Roles of these specific CBPs include *promoting primary immune response *mediating leukocyte trafficking to sites of inflammation *mediating lymphocyte recirculation *mediating platelet binding to neutrophils
===Clinical Use of Lectins=== Pure forms of lectins are used for blood typing. Specifically, lectins are used to identify some glycolipids and glycoproteins on an individual's red blood cells. In the brain, PHA-L, a lectin from a kidney bean, helps to trace the path of efferent axons through the anterograde labeling method. [[Image:Phytohemagglutinin L.png|frame|PHA-L]]
==Siglecs== Siglecs occur mostly in humans, but some are also found in murines. Some of the primary roles of these CBPs are: *regulator in B cell activation *maintenance of myelin *inhibitor of axonal growth
==Galectins== Galectins are also found in humans, mice, and rats as well. These CBPs are abundant in most organs such as muscles, hearts, lung, liver, lymph nodes, thymus, and colon, stomach epithelial cells, gastrointestimal, erythroctyes, skin, brain, Hodgkin's lymphoma, kidney, and lens. Roles include: *acting as a marker for cell recognition *binding specificity
=References= http://web.mit.edu/glycomics/consortium/organization/program/program1.pdf
{{BookCat}}

{{mbox|type=serious|msg='''Please help <u>''improve''</u> Wikibooks'''.
[[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|Recent edits]] you made have not been considered constructive by your fellow contributors. Please use the [[Wikibooks:Sandbox|sandbox]] in the future if you wish to test something out. For a description of the type of content that we do allow, see [[WB:WIW]]. If you have questions about this, or need help, ask at the [[WB:HELP|Reading Room Assistance]] page. Thanks. --[[User:Jomegat|Jomegat]] ([[User talk:Jomegat|talk]]) 16:36, 13 October 2008 (UTC)}}

After each purification steps, the types of [[Structural Biochemistry/Proteins|protein]] that exist in the in the solution is expected to decrease while its specific activity is expected to increase. These two qualities are desirable because experiment done using a pure protein sample gives a more quantifiable result. One method used to check the purity of the sample is using a form of Gel Electrophoresis, such as [[Structural Biochemistry/Proteins/Purification/SDS-Polyacrylamide Gel Electrophoresis|SDS PAGE]] or native PAGE.
Purification can also be quantitatively evaluated by measuring total protein, total activity, specific activity, yield and purification level. Total protein is the quantity of protein present in a fraction and can be determined by measuring the protein concentration of a part of each fraction and multiplying by the fraction's total volume. Total activity is measured by the enzymatic activity in the volume of fraction used in the assay multiplied by the fraction's total volume. Specific activity is the total activity divided by total protein. The yield is the amount of activity retained after each purification step. The purification level is the increase of purity which can be measured after each purification step by dividing its specific activity by the specific activity of the initial extract.
{{BookCat}}
a good purification takes into account both purification levels of yield. A high amount of purification and a poor yield give little protein to work with. on the other hands, a low purification and a high yield give contaminated protein in the experiment.

revision.comment: /* Gel Electrophoresis in DNA Fingerprinting */ add how to visuallize protein in a gel
revision.text:
== General information == '''Gel electrophoresis''' is a technique used to display and assert that the [[Structural Biochemistry/Proteins/Purification|purification]] scheme was effective by measuring the number of different proteins in a mixture. The basis of gel electrophoresis is the fact that molecule with specific net charge will move through an electric field. The speed of protein migration can be quantified as: <big>
<math>v = Ez/f</math></big>
With ''E'' as magnitude of the electric field, ''z'' as net charge of a protein, and ''f'' as frictional kinetic coefficient.
Frictional coefficient, for spherical molecule, is determined as:
''<big>f = 6 π η r</big>''
with η as viscosity.
As its equation implies, the velocity of molecule traveling in the gel matrix depends on its size, shape, and the charge that it has. The smaller the molecule, the faster it will travel. Furthermore, Gels can be made in a variety of wt percents: 6%, 8%, 10%, 12% and 15%. Higher percentages are used primarily for smaller molecules and smaller percentages are used for larger sized samples. Theoretically, larger molecules can still be used with higher percents, but these gels may take a long time to develop. Charge can also be a factor in the speed and distance that a specific sample travels through the gel. Using a higher voltage will send the samples farther and faster. However, caution must be used with higher voltages as the heat it generates may melt the gels.
Gel Electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE; SDS-polyacrylamide Gel Electrophoresis) is a powerful tool to check the purity of the sample because because it can detect minuscule amount of protein. Different proteins appear as different bands on SDS-Polyacrylamide Gel after gel has been stained with Coomassie blue (visualize ~2pm of protein) or silver stain (visualize 0.02 µg of protein).
== Native Gel Electrophoresis == Native Gel Electrophoresis involves running gels with samples in its native state. In doing so, the charge of the molecule becomes a factor in addition to size. More specifically, more charged molecules will migrate faster and farther than less charged molecules of comparable mass. Likewise, larger molecules will migrate less and at slower speeds than another molecule of comparable charge. Native Gel Electrophoresis most often involves two types of gels - Agarose and Polyacrylamide. Agarose is a derivative of the cell membranes of red algae composed of polysaccharides agarose and agaropectin, and due to the larger size of the pores, agarose gels are better suited for protein samples larger than 200 kilodaltons. Polyacrylamide (poly 2-propenamide, is a readily-crosslinked polymer of the neurotoxin acrylamide. It's pores are more fine, and while agarose is most commonly used for most cases, polyacrylamide is the gel of choice for smaller sample masses.
== The Use of SDS (sodium dodecyl sulfate) == [[Image:Sds.png|right|200px]] [[image:SDS-PAGE.jpg|200px|thumbnail|SDS Page. The Molecular Marker is located in the left lane.]]
Electrophoresis involves the movement of particles due to electric current on the basis of size, charge of molecules, amount of current, etc. S[[Structural Biochemistry/Proteins/Purification/SDS-Polyacrylamide Gel Electrophoresis|SDS PAGE]] is a technique used to separate proteins based on size, and size alone. Sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS) is a detergent that binds to proteins at every 2 amino acids in its sequence, and as SDS is very negative on its own, it changes the overall charge of the molecule to a negative charge. This negative charge is proportional to the protein's mass on the basis that the amount of SDS bound to the molecule is based on how many doublets of amino acids are present. The negative charge put on the protein is much larger than the charge originally there, which allows for a similar charge-to-mass ratio between different proteins. When SDS binds to proteins, it also changes the conformation of the proteins into similar shapes by denaturing the proteins and changing its bonds. SDS allows gel electrophoresis to separate proteins based on their molecular weights since the mass-to-charge ratio is relatively uniform among the proteins. This is because the SDS gel has sieving properties (offers resistance to particles based on their size)and is a uniform environment. It increases the differential mobility. The mobility of these proteins are then linearly proportional to the logarithm of their mass. Using this information, we can conclude from their mobility the mass of the protein and can even distinguish proteins that have a 2% difference in mass. Thus, the largest molecules, the ones that have more SDS bound to them, will fall down the electric field slower than the ones that have a smaller mass, and less SDS bound to them. This principle is contrary to the one in size-exclusion (gel-filtration) chromatography, which causes heavier molecules to come down first while the lighter ones come out later.
Certain solvents, such as PEG, glycerol, ethanol, and isopropanol, have an effect of decreasing the hydrodynamic radius of the proteins by decreasing the amount of free water to provide hydration spheres for the proteins. The polar solvents will hydrogen bond with the water, decreasing the disorder around the proteins and as a result, reducing the size of the hydration sphere. In such case, proteins will be eluted at a later stage as if they were of smaller size.
After the process is complete, the proteins are stained with a dye, forming bands, which represent the layers of mobility of each protein. With each additional purification process, the electrophoresis yields less bands, but a single darker band, which consequently represents the increased presence of the protein being isolated.
== Two-Dimensional Gel Electrophoresis == The separation techniques of SDS-PAGE and isoelectric focusing can be utilized in conjunction to allow for 2DGE, which employs higher resolution and sensitivity in the separation of proteins. The first dimension of this powerful technique is isoelectric focusing (IEF) and the second dimension is polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (PAGE). In the first dimension, proteins are separated according to their isoelectric point (pI). To do so, the gel is applied to the top of an SDS-polyacrylamide slab. Electrophoresis is then applied horizontally across the top of the gel and the proteins migrate into the second-dimension gel. Electrophoresis will then be applied again, this time vertically across the gel slab, and the proteins will migrate based on their molecular size. Heavier proteins will move shorter distances. Conversely, lighter proteins will move further.
While Two-Dimensional Gel Electrophoresis is a powerful technique that presents a higher resolution of separation, it does have its own limitations. 2DGE is a time-consuming and labor-intensive process, requiring manual gel polymerization, staining, and hours upon hours of separation. Furthermore, the technique is not without risk. Because heating of the gel may cause warping and diffusion of the molecules on the gel surface, 2DGE is difficult to reproduce.
==Gel Electrophoresis in DNA Fingerprinting == [[image:Pcr_fingerprint.png|200px|thumbnail| DNA Fingerprint. Each sample has a different pattern of bands indicating these samples are from three different individuals.]] DNA fingerprinting is a technique used to differentiate between different organisms based on the differences between each organism’s DNA configuration. DNA fingerprinting is often used by forensics labs to identify criminals by comparing a suspect’s DNA to the DNA found at a crime scene. DNA from the suspect is run through a gel electrophoresis and compared to a sample of DNA that was found at the scene. If the two samples produce identical band patterns in the gel, then confirmation that the suspect was at the scene of the crime can be made, since no two people possess identical patterns in their DNA.
In order to perform a fingerprint, a sample containing DNA must be obtained from each organism under evaluation. Examples of DNA samples include blood, urine, saliva, skin or hair. Before the samples can be analyzed, they must first be prepared. Preparation includes using restriction enzymes to separate the DNA into smaller pieces. Restriction enzymes are enzymes that cut DNA strands at specific nucleotides. These nucleotides are called restriction sites, and typically mark the end of a 4-8 unit sequence in nucleotides. The components and length of each restriction sequence vary from person to person, thus the use of restriction enzymes is an efficient way of separating an organism’s DNA into unique and specific sections. Additionally, certain amount of chemicals are also inserted as dye into the gel which will illuminate under UV light. This causes the bands to be much more visible when analyzing the sample protein.
Regions of DNA that contain many different short repeated sequences are called microsatellites. The lengths of these microsatellites vary greatly from person to person, which makes them prime locations for restriction enzymes to fragment the DNA. After treating the DNA samples with restriction enzymes, the DNA is now ready to be analyzed. The samples are loaded into the wells in a slab of gel, and an electric current is applied. Smaller fragments of DNA run through the gel faster, and will therefore be closer to the bottom, while larger fractions remain closer to the top. If two samples of DNA are run at the same time, the locations of the bands can be compared. If the patterns of bands between the two samples are identical, it means that the restriction enzymes partitioned each sample’s DNA at the same locations, indicating the two DNA samples had identical nucleotide sequencing. Identical nucleotide sequencing reveals the two samples are from the same organism.
DNA fingerprinting is also a useful technique to determine whether or not two people are related. Although no two people share the same DNA patterns, sections of microsatellites are passed down from parent to child. Not all of these sections are passed down, but offspring do not contain any pattern that their parents did not possess. A paternity or maternity test can be performed by comparing the DNA fingerprint of the individuals in question. If there are large groups of patterns that repeat in each sample’s fingerprint, it is likely that the individuals are related. The embedded image contains a three different DNA fingerprints, as indicated by the three different patterns of bands. Although these patterns represent fingerprints from different people, sample 2 shares similar patterns with both 1 and 3, which indicates that the person whose DNA is represented by sample 2 is likely to be the child of sample 1 and 3.
Maternal and paternal DNA fingerprinting tests are used to determine the probability of two people being related. These tests do not give definitive answers, and are not foolproof.
== Visualization of protein in gels == As most proteins are not directly visible on gels to the naked eye, a method has to be employed in order to visualize them following electrophoresis. The most commonly used protein stain is the dye Coomassie brilliant blue. After electrophoresis, the gel containing the separated proteins is immersed in an acidic alcoholic solution of the dye. This denatures the proteins, fixes them in the gel so that they do not wash out, and allows the dye to bind to them. After washing away excesse dye, the proteins are visible as discrete blue bands. As little as 0.1-1.0 µg of a protein in a gel can be visualized using Coomassie brilliant blue. A more sensitive general protein stain involves soaking the gel in a silver salt solution. However, this technique is rather more difficult to apply. If the protein sample is radioactive the proteins cna be visualized indirectly by overlaying the gel with a sheet of X-ray film. With time (hours to weeks depending on the radioactivity of the sample proteins), the radiation emitted will cause a darkening of the film. Upon development of the film the resulting autoradiograph will have darkened areas corresponding to the positions of the radiolabeled proteins. Another way of visualizing the protein of interest is to use an antibody against the protein in an immunoblot (Western blot). For this techinique, the proteins have to be transferred out of the gel on to a sheet of nitrocellular or nylon membrane. This is accomplished by overlaying the gel with the nitrocellulose then has an exact image of the pattern that was in the gel. The excess binding sites on the nitrocellulose are then blocked with a nonspecific protein solution such as milk powder, before placing the nitrocellulose in a solution cantaining the antibody that recognizes the protein of interest (the primary antibody). After removing excess unbound antibody, the primary antibody that is now specifically bound to the protein of interest is detected with either a radiolabeled, fluorescent or enzyme-coupled secondary antibody. Finally, the secondary antibody is detected either by placing the nitrocellulose against a sheet of X-ray film (if a radiolabeled secondary antibody has been used), by using a fluorescence detector or by adding to the nitrocellulose a solution of a substrate that is converted into a colored insoluble product by the enzyme that is coupled to the secondary antibody.
==References == Hames, David. Hooper, Nigel. Biochemisty. Third edition. Taylor and Francis Group. New York. 2005.
http://www.sciencebuddies.org/science-fair-projects/project_ideas/BioChem_p009.shtml
{{BookCat}}

revision.comment: Welcome
revision.text:
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, AM Correa MGCR331!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |
[[Image:Crystal Clear app korganizer.png|20px]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing here and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' for the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything, and changes can be made easily. Come [[WB:HELP|introduce yourself]] to everyone, and let us know what interests you.
[[Image:Icon apps query.svg|20px]] '''Getting help'''
* Get help from the community in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * We tag pages with various [[WB:TM|message templates]], such as {{tlx|query}}, to let editors know what needs to be improved. To learn more about these, ask at [[WB:PROJECTS|the projects reading room]]. * You cannot upload an image until you have been a member for at least '''4 days'''. If your upload is tagged with {{tlx|nld}}, {{tlx|bfu}}, or {{tlx|nfur}}, please read the template message as it explains the violation of [[WB:MEDIA|our media policy]]. Please be sure to provide the required {{tlx|information}}: a [[WB:ICT|license tag]] and source citation are always required; fair use images require a {{tlx|fair use rationale}}. Get help in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]]. | style="padding:0em 0.5em 0em 0.5em;" | | style="width:55%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #abd5f5; background-color:#f1f5fc;" |
[[Image:Transmission icon.png|20px]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please [[:w:Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on discussion pages by typing ~~~~ * If you're coming here from Wikipedia, you should read [[WB:WFW|our primer for Wikipedians]] to get up-to-speed quickly. * '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[Image:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 17:52, 13 October 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} ==[[Work and Life in the Mobile Society/5.2.1]]== I notice you blanked that page you just created - did you want that page deleted? I can take care of that if you like; you can reply here or on my talk page.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 17:52, 13 October 2008 (UTC)

page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0016

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=I Feel Sick|id=A0016}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} It's never good when someone doesn't feel well but at least you can use the opportunity to start a small conversation in Spanish. The keywords are '''pobrecito''' – poor guy, and '''¿Qué tienes?''' – What's wrong with you? {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0006|A0006: How's it going?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0076|A0076: Jet-lag]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0116|A0116: Do you want a mint?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=I feel sick|id=A0016|dialogueid=A0016 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Hombre, ¿qué te pasa?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Me siento mal.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Qué tienes?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Me duele el estómago.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Pobrecito.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Hombre,''' || '''¿qué''' || '''te''' || '''pasa?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''man'' || ''what'' || ''(to) you'' || ''(it) happens'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| Hey, what's happening to you? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Me''' || '''siento''' || '''mal.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''myself'' || ''(I) feel'' || ''badly'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| I don't feel so good. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Qué''' || '''tienes?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''what'' || ''(you) have'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| What's wrong with you? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Me''' || '''duele''' || '''el''' || '''estómago.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(to) me'' || ''hurts'' || ''the'' || ''stomach'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| My stomach hurts. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Pobrecito.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0016 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''poor guy'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| Poor little dude. |- |}
[[Image:Stomach diagram.svg|thumb|'''el estómago''' – the stomach|120px]] [[Image:Carl Spitzweg - Der arme Poet (Neue Pinakothek).jpg|thumb|'''pobre''' – poor|160px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''¿qué?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || what? |- || '''te''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) you |- || '''pasar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to happen |- || '''(él/ella) pasa''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) happens |- || '''se''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || oneself |- || '''sentirse''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to feel (oneself) |- || '''me''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || myself |- || '''(yó) me siento''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I feel (myself) |- || '''mal''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || badly |- || '''tener''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to have |- || '''(tú) tienes''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you have (informal, singular) |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- || '''doler''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to hurt |- || '''(él/ella) duele''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) hurts |- || '''el estómago''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the stomach |- || '''pobre''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || poor |- || '''el pobrecito''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the poor little guy |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{Wikipedia|El Gordo de la Primitiva}} ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''gordo/gorda''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || fat |- || '''el gordito''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the chubby guy |- || '''poco/poca''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || little |- || '''el poquito''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the little cute bit |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || (to) you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) you (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || (to) us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || (to) you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) them |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) you (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''pasar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to happen |- |align="right"| '''(yo) paso''' || {{SbcPT}} || I happen |- |align="right"| '''(tú) pasas''' || || you happen (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) pasa''' || || he/she(/it) happens |- |align="right"| '''(usted) pasa''' || || you happen (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) pasamos''' || || we happen (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) pasáis''' || || you happen (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) pasan''' || || they happen (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) pasan''' || || you happen (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || myself |- |align="right"| '''te''' || || yourself (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || himself/herself(/itself) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || yourself (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos''' || || ourselves, each other |- |align="right"| '''os''' || || yourselves, each other (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || themselves, each other |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || yourselves, each other (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''sentirse''' || {{SbcInf}} || to feel (oneself) |- |align="right"| '''(yo) me siento''' || {{SbcPT}} || I feel (myself) |- |align="right"| '''(tú) te sientes''' || || you feel (yourself) (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) se siente''' || || he/she(/it) feels (himself/herself/itself) |- |align="right"| '''(usted) se siente''' || || you feel (yourself) (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) nos sentimos''' || || we feel (ourselves) (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) os sentís''' || || you feel (yourselves) (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) se sienten''' || || they feel (themselves) (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) se sienten''' || || you feel (yourselves) (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''tener''' || {{SbcInf}} || to have |- |align="right"| '''(yo) tengo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I have |- |align="right"| '''(tú) tienes''' || || you have (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) tiene''' || || he/she(/it) has |- |align="right"| '''(usted) tiene''' || || you have (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) tenemos'''|| || we have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) tenéis'''|| || you have (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) tienen'''|| || they have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) tienen''' || || you have (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''doler''' || {{SbcInf}} || to hurt |- |align="right"| '''(yo) duelo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I hurt |- |align="right"| '''(tú) dueles''' || || you hurt (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) duele''' || || he/she(/it) hurts |- |align="right"| '''(usted) duele''' || || you have (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) dolemos'''|| || we hurt (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) doléis'''|| || you hurt (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) duelen'''|| || they hurt (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) duelen''' || || you hurt (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Hombre, ¿qué te pasa?''' | Hey, what's happening to you? | '''Me siento mal.''' | I don't feel so good. | '''¿Qué tienes?''' | What's wrong with you? | '''Me duele el estómago.''' | My stomach hurts. | '''Pobrecito.''' | Poor little dude. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Hombre, ¿qué te pasa?''' | Hey, what's happening to you? | '''Me siento mal.''' | I don't feel so good. | '''¿Qué tienes?''' | What's wrong with you? | '''Me duele el estómago.''' | My stomach hurts. | '''Pobrecito.''' | Poor little dude. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Man, what's happening to you? | '''Hombre, ¿qué te pasa?''' | I don't feel so good. | '''Me siento mal.''' | What's wrong with you? | '''¿Qué tienes?''' | My stomach hurts. | '''Me duele el estómago.''' | Poor guy. | '''Pobrecito.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Man, what's happening to you? | '''Hombre, ¿qué te pasa?''' | I don't feel so good. | '''Me siento mal.''' | What's wrong with you? | '''¿Qué tienes?''' | My stomach hurts. | '''Me duele el estómago.''' | Poor guy. | '''Pobrecito.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Hey! | '''¡Hombre!''' | What's up? ({{=}} What happens?) | '''¿Qué pasa?''' | I feel very ({{=}} '''muy''') bad. | '''Me siento muy mal.''' | What's your problem? | '''¿Qué tienes?''' | I have a headache. ({{=}} The head ({{=}} '''la cabeza''') hurts to me.) | '''Me duele la cabeza.''' | I feel sorry. ({{=}} It ({{=}} '''lo''') I feel.) | '''Lo siento.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hey! | '''¡Hombre!''' | What's up? ({{=}} What happens?) | '''¿Qué pasa?''' | I feel very ({{=}} '''muy''') bad. | '''Me siento muy mal.''' | What's your problem? | '''¿Qué tienes?''' | I have a headache. ({{=}} The head ({{=}} '''la cabeza''') hurts to me.) | '''Me duele la cabeza.''' | I feel sorry. ({{=}} It ({{=}} '''lo''') I feel.) | '''Lo siento.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | What's happening to you? (formal, plural) | '''¿Qué les pasa?''' | We don't feel so good. | '''Nos sentimos mal.''' | What's wrong with you? (formal, plural) | '''¿Qué tienen (ustedes)?''' | My stomach hurts. | '''Me duele el estómago.''' | Poor little guy. | '''Pobrecito.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What's happening to you? (formal, plural) | '''¿Qué les pasa?''' | We don't feel so good. | '''Nos sentimos mal.''' | What's wrong with you? (formal, plural) | '''¿Qué tienen (ustedes)?''' | My stomach hurts. | '''Me duele el estómago.''' | Poor little guy. | '''Pobrecito.''' }}</includeonly>
<includeonly>===Image Credits=== *“Image:Stomach diagram.svg” by Indolences at en.wikipedia (Public Domain) *“Image:Carl Spitzweg 017.jpg” by Carl Spitzweg (Public Domain)</includeonly> <noinclude>{{SbcNavigateSpanishPod|A0015|A0016|A0019}}</noinclude>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=How Do You Spell ‘Beige?’|id=A0019}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} You have a question? Liliana and JP tell us how to ask it. Specifically, they talk about a spelling question; thus, the keyword is '''be de burro''' – b as in donkey (b as in Bob). {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0005|A0005: Take a picture]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0008|A0008: How do you say ...?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0011|A0011: Call me]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=How do you spell ‘beige?’|id=A0019|dialogueid=A0019 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Tengo una pregunta.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0019 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Dime!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0019 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Cómo se escribe beige?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0019 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿El color? Se escribe con be de burro, e, i, ge, e.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0019 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0019 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}

You write it with b as in Bob, e, i, g, e. |- |}

(informal, singular) |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- || '''¡dime!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || tell me! |- || '''¿cómo?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || how? |- || '''se''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || itself, one, you |- || '''escribir''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to write |- || '''(él/ella) escribe''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) writes |- || '''beige''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || beige |- || '''el color''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the color |- || '''con''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || with |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''el burro''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the donkey |- || '''la be de burro''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || the b as in donkey |- || '''la e''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the e |- || '''la i''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the i |- || '''la ge''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the g |- || '''gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thanks |- |}

{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Tengo una pregunta.''' | I have a question. | '''¡Dime!''' | Tell me! | '''¿Cómo se escribe beige?''' | How do you write beige? | '''¿El color? Se escribe con be de burro, e, i, ge, e.''' | The color? You write it with b as in Bob, e, i, g, e. | '''Gracias.''' | Thanks. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Tengo una pregunta.''' | I have a question. | '''¡Dime!''' | Tell me! | '''¿Cómo se escribe beige?''' | How do you write beige? | '''¿El color? Se escribe con be de burro, e, i, ge, e.''' | The color? You write it with b as in Bob, e, i, g, e. | '''Gracias.''' | Thanks. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | I have a question. | '''Tengo una pregunta.''' | Tell me! | '''¡Dime!''' | How do you write beige? | '''¿Cómo se escribe beige?''' | The color? You write it with b as in Bob, e, i, g, e. | '''¿El color? Se escribe con be de burro, e, i, ge, e.''' | Thanks. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | I have a question. | '''Tengo una pregunta.''' | Tell me! | '''¡Dime!''' | How do you write beige? | '''¿Cómo se escribe beige?''' | The color? You write it with b as in Bob, e, i, g, e. | '''¿El color? Se escribe con be de burro, e, i, ge, e.''' | Thanks. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Tell me a question! | '''¡Dime una pregunta!''' | I have one. | '''Tengo una.''' | Tell me! | '''¡Dime!''' | How do you write escribir? | '''¿Cómo se escribe escribir?''' | One writes e, s, c, r, i, b, i, r. | '''Se escribe e, ese, ce, ere, i, be de burro, i, ere.''' | Thanks. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Tell me a question! | '''¡Dime una pregunta!''' | I have one. | '''Tengo una.''' | Tell me! | '''¡Dime!''' | How do you write escribir? | '''¿Cómo se escribe escribir?''' | One writes e, s, c, r, i, b, i, r. | '''Se escribe e, ese, ce, ere, i, be de burro, i, ere.''' | Thanks. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | We have a question. | '''Tenemos una pregunta.''' | You tell me! (formal, plural) | '''¡Díganme!''' | How do you write beige? | '''¿Cómo se escribe beige?''' | The color? You write it with b as in Bob, e, i, g, e. | '''¿El color? Se escribe con be de burro, e, i, ge, e.''' | Thanks. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | We have a question. | '''Tenemos una pregunta.''' | You tell me! Se escribe con be de burro, e, i, ge, e.''' | Thanks. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=I'm Sleepy|id=A0021}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} You only get what you ask for (in capitalism at least); thus, you better know how to express your preferences. Sometimes you might even have to give a reason for them. But don't worry, JP and Liliana tell us how. Furthermore, they talk about the many ways of saying good bye. Our keyphrase is '''tengo sueño''' – I'm sleepy. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0002|A0002: Birthday party]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0010|A0010: I'm hungry]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0076|A0076: Jet-lag]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=I'm sleepy|id=A0021|dialogueid=A0021 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Quieres salir hoy?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''No, prefiero quedarme en casa.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Por qué?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Tengo sueño.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Ni modo. Nos vemos mañana.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Quieres''' || '''salir''' || '''hoy?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(you) want'' || ''go out'' || ''today'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| Do you want to go out today? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''No,''' || '''prefiero''' || '''quedarme''' || '''en''' || '''casa.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''no'' || ''(I) prefer'' || ''stay (myself)'' || ''in'' || ''house'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| No, I prefer to stay at home. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Por''' || '''qué?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''by'' || ''what'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| Why? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Tengo''' || '''sueño.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(I) have'' || ''sleep'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| I'm sleepy. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Ni modo.''' || '''Nos''' || '''vemos''' || '''mañana.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0021 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''no way'' || ''each other'' || ''(we) see'' || ''tomorrow'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| Too bad. We see each other tomorrow. |- |}
[[Image:Spain.Barcelona.Casa.Mila.jpg|thumb|'''la casa''' – the house|160px]] [[Image:A.Cortina El sueño.jpg|thumb|'''el sueño''' – the sleep|160px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''querer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to want, to like |- || '''(tú) quieres''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you want (informal, singular) |- || '''salir''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to go out |- || '''hoy''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || today |- || '''no''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || no |- || '''preferir''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to prefer |- || '''(yo) prefiero''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I prefer |- || '''se''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || oneself |- || '''quedarse''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to stay (oneself) |- || '''me''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || myself |- || '''en''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || in |- || '''la casa''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the house |- || '''en casa''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || at home |- || '''¿por qué?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || why? |- || '''tener''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to have |- || '''(yo) tengo''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I have |- || '''el sueño''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the sleep |- || '''tener sueño''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || to be sleepy |- || '''ni modo''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || too bad, no way |- || '''nos''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || us, each other |- || '''ver''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to see |- || '''(nosotros/-as) vemos''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || we see |- || '''nos vemos''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see ya, we see each other |- || '''mañana''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || tomorrow |- |}

{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''querer''' || {{SbcInf}} || to want |- |align="right"| '''(yo) quiero''' || {{SbcPT}} || I want |- |align="right"| '''(tú) quieres''' || || you (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) quieren''' || || you want (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''salir''' || {{SbcInf}}|| to go out |- |align="right"| '''(yo) salgo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I go out |- |align="right"| '''(tú) sales''' || || you go out (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) sale''' || || he/she(/it) goes out |- |align="right"| '''(usted) sale''' || || you Nos vemos mañana.''' | Too bad. We see each other tomorrow. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Quieres salir hoy?''' | Do you want go out today? | '''No, prefiero quedarme en casa.''' | No, I prefer to stay at home. | '''¿Por qué?''' | Why? | '''Tengo sueño.''' | I'm sleepy. | '''Ni modo. Nos vemos mañana.''' | Too bad. We see each other tomorrow. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Do you want to go out today? | '''¿Quieres salir hoy?''' | No, I prefer to stay at home. | '''No, prefiero quedarme en casa.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | I'm sleepy. | '''Tengo sueño.''' | Too bad. We see each other tomorrow. | '''Ni modo. Nos vemos mañana.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you want to go out today? | '''¿Quieres salir hoy?''' | No, I prefer to stay at home. | '''No, prefiero quedarme en casa.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | I'm sleepy. | '''Tengo sueño.''' | Too bad. We see each other tomorrow. | '''Ni modo. Nos vemos mañana.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Do you want to go out? | '''¿Quieres salir?''' | No, not today. I prefer to go out tomorrow. | '''No, hoy no. Prefiero salir mañana.''' | You don't want to go out today? | '''¿No quieres salir hoy?''' | No. Why don't you want to go out tomorrow? | '''No. ¿Por qué no quieres salir mañana? ''' | I prefer to go out today. | '''Prefiero salir hoy.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | Tomorrow I'm sleepy. | '''Mañana tengo sueño.''' | What? | '''¿Qué?''' | I prefer to stay at home tomorrow. | '''Prefiero quedarme en casa mañana.''' | Too bad. Do we see each other tomorrow? | '''Ni modo. ¿Nos vemos mañana?''' | No. Good bye. | '''No. Adiós.''' | See you soon! | '''¡Hasta pronto!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you want to go out? | '''¿Quieres salir?''' | No, not today. I prefer to go out tomorrow. | '''No, hoy no. Prefiero salir mañana.''' | You don't want to go out today? | '''¿No quieres salir hoy?''' | No. Why don't you want to go out tomorrow? | '''No. ¿Por qué no quieres salir mañana? ''' | I prefer to go out today. | '''Prefiero salir hoy.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | Tomorrow I'm sleepy. | '''Mañana tengo sueño.''' | What? | '''¿Qué?''' | I prefer to stay at home tomorrow. | '''Prefiero quedarme en casa mañana.''' | Too bad. Do we see each other tomorrow? | '''Ni modo. ¿Nos vemos mañana?''' | No. Good bye. | '''No. Adiós.''' | See you soon! | '''¡Hasta pronto!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Do you want to go out today? (plural) | '''¿Queréis salir hoy?''' | No, we prefer to stay at home. | '''No, preferimos quedarnos en casa.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | We're sleepy. | '''Tenemos sueño.''' | Too bad. We see each other tomorrow. | '''Ni modo. Nos vemos mañana.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you want to go out today? (plural) | '''¿Queréis salir hoy?''' | No, we prefer to stay at home. | '''No, preferimos quedarnos en casa.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | We're sleepy. | '''Tenemos sueño.''' | Too bad. We see each other tomorrow. | '''Ni modo. Nos vemos mañana.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.comment: Commons deletion request closed.
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Going to the Market|id=A0023}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} We are going shopping! This time for fresh apples. Yummy! The keywords are: '''verde''' – green and '''roja''' – red (for feminine nouns). {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0047|A0047: Coffee time]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0066|A0066: Bottle of water]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0122|A0122: Telephone card]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Going to the Market|id=A0023|dialogueid=A0023 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Manzana verde o roja?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Verde, por favor.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Algo más?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''No, es todo. Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Buenas''' || '''tardes.''' || '''¿Me''' || '''da''' || '''un''' || '''kilo''' || '''de''' || '''manzana?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''good'' || ''afternoons'' || ''(to) me'' || ''(you) give'' || ''a'' || ''kilo'' || ''of'' || ''apples'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=8| Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Manzana''' || '''verde''' || '''o''' || '''roja?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''apple'' || ''green'' || ''or'' || ''red'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| Green apples or red ones? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Verde,''' || '''por favor.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''green'' || ''please'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| Green, please. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Algo''' || '''más?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''something'' || ''more'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| Anything else? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''No,''' || '''es''' || '''todo.''' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0023 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''no'' || ''(it) is'' || ''all'' || ''thanks'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| No, that's all. Thanks. |- |}
[[Image:Goldkey logo removed.jpg|thumb|'''el kilo''' – the kilo|160px]] [[Image:Chrisdesign Photorealistic Green Apple.svg|thumb|'''la manzana verde''' – the green apple|120px]] [[Image:Deutsche Pomologie - Aepfel - 028.jpg|thumb|'''la manzana roja''' – the red apple|160px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''bueno/buena''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || good |- || '''buenos/buenas''' || {{SbcAdjectivePMF}} || good |- || '''la tarde''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the afternoon |- || '''las tardes''' || {{SbcNounPF}} || the afternoons |- || '''buenas tardes''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || good afternoon |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- || '''dar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to give |- || '''(usted) da''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you give (formal, singular) |- || '''(usted) me da''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || you give to me (formal, singular) |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''el kilo''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the kilo |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''la manzana''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the apple |- || '''verde''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || green |- || '''rojo/roja''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || red |- || '''por favor''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || please |- || '''algo''' || {{SbcPronoun}} || something |- || '''más''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || more |- || '''no''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || no |- || '''ser''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) es''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''todo''' || {{SbcPronoun}} || all |- || '''gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thanks |- |}
{{Wikipedia|tianguis}} [[Image:Eloxochitlán - Tianguis.jpg|thumb|'''el tianguis''' – the Mexican market|160px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''el día''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the day |- || '''los días''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the days |- || '''buenos días''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || good morning |- || '''(tú) das''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you give (informal, singular) |- || '''(tú) me das''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || you give to me (informal, singular) |- || '''el tianguis''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the Mexican market |- || '''nada''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || nothing |- || '''nada más''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || nothing else |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || (to) you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) you (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || (to) us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || (to) you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) them |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) you (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''dar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to give |- |align="right"| '''(yo) doy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I give |- |align="right"| '''(tú) das''' || || you give (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) da''' || || he/she(/it) gives |- |align="right"| '''(usted) da''' || || you give (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) damos'''|| || we give (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) dais'''|| || you give (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) dan'''|| || they give (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) dan''' || || you give (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''ser''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) soy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) eres''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) es''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) es''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) somos'''|| || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) sois'''|| || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) son'''|| || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) son''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana?''' | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples? | '''¿Manzana verde o roja?''' | Green apples or red ones? | '''Verde, por favor.''' | Green, please. | '''¿Algo más?''' | Anything else? | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' | No, that's all. Thanks. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana?''' | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples? | '''¿Manzana verde o roja?''' | Green apples or red ones? | '''Verde, por favor.''' | Green, please. | '''¿Algo más?''' | Anything else? | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' | No, that's all. Thanks. }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples? | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana?''' | Green apples or red ones? | '''¿Manzana verde o roja?''' | Green, please. | '''Verde, por favor.''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | No, that's all. Thanks. | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples? | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana?''' | Green apples or red ones? | '''¿Manzana verde o roja?''' | Green, please. | '''Verde, por favor.''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | No, that's all. Thanks. | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Good afternoon. | '''Buenas tardes.''' | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples, please? | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana, por favor?''' | Green apples? | '''¿Manzana verde?''' | No, a kilo of red apples, please. | '''No, un kilo de manzana roja, por favor.''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | One kilo more. | '''Un kilo más.''' | Is that all? | '''¿Es todo?''' | No. Will you give me a kilo of green apples? | '''No. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana verde?''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | No, that's all. Thanks. | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Good afternoon. | '''Buenas tardes.''' | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples, please? | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana, por favor?''' | Green apples? | '''¿Manzana verde?''' | No, a kilo of red apples, please. | '''No, un kilo de manzana roja, por favor.''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | One kilo more. | '''Un kilo más.''' | Is that all? | '''¿Es todo?''' | No. Will you give me a kilo of green apples? | '''No. ¿Me da un kilo de manzana verde?''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | No, that's all. Thanks. | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples? (informal) | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me das un kilo de manzana?''' | Green apples or red ones? | '''¿Manzana verde o roja?''' | Green, please. | '''Verde, por favor.''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | No, that's all. Thanks. | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Good afternoon. Will you give me a kilo of apples? (informal) | '''Buenas tardes. ¿Me das un kilo de manzana?''' | Green apples or red ones? | '''¿Manzana verde o roja?''' | Green, please. | '''Verde, por favor.''' | Anything else? | '''¿Algo más?''' | No, that's all. Thanks. | '''No, es todo. Gracias.''' }}</includeonly>

page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0027

revision.comment: move audio link to end
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=The Neighbor|id=A0027}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Yes, there is something for everyone: Here comes the anti-social dialogue! On the other hand, talking about neighbors is a pretty social activity, isn't it? In any case, the keyword is: '''tampoco''' – not either. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0004|A0004: She's not Mexican]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0030|A0030: Call back later]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0072|A0072: Here is my card]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=The Neighbor|id=A0027|dialogueid=A0027 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Ahí viene el vecino.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Lo conoces?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''No, no lo conozco. ¿Y tú?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Tampoco.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Ahí''' || '''viene''' || '''el''' || '''vecino.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''there'' || ''(he) comes'' || ''the'' || ''neighbor'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| Here comes the neighbor. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Lo''' || '''conoces?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''him'' || ''(you) know'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| Do you know him? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''No,''' || '''no''' || '''lo''' || '''conozco.''' || '''¿Y''' || '''tú?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''no'' || ''not'' || ''him'' || ''(I) know'' || ''and'' || ''you'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=6| No, I don't know him. How about you? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Tampoco.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0027 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''not either'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=1| Me neither. |- |}
{{Wikipedia|vecino}} [[Image:HombresIlustresStreetLosReyesMexico.JPG|thumb|'''los vecinos''' – the neighbors|160px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''ahí''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || there |- || '''venir''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to come |- || '''(él/ella) viene''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) comes |- || '''el vecino''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the (male) neighbor |- || '''lo''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || him |- || '''conocer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to know |- || '''(tú) conoces''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you know (informal, singular) |- || '''no''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || no, not |- || '''(yo) conozco''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I know |- || '''y''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || and |- || '''tú''' || {{SbcSubjectPronoun}} || you |- || '''tampoco''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || not either |- |}
{{Wikipedia|vecindad}} ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''la vecina''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the (female) neighbor |- || '''la''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || her |- || '''yo tampoco''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || me neither |- || '''tener''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to have |- || '''(yo) tengo''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I have |- || '''el dinero''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the money |- || '''no tengo dinero''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || I don't have money |- || '''el fraccionamiento''' || {{SbcNounM}} || residential area |- || '''la vecindad''' || {{SbcNounM}} || neighborhood sharing a court yard |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''venir''' || {{SbcInf}} || to come |- |align="right"| '''(yo) vengo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I come |- |align="right"| '''(tú) vienes''' || || you come (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) viene''' || || he/she(/it) comes |- |align="right"| '''(usted) viene''' || || you come (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) venimos'''|| || we come (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) venís'''|| || you come (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) vienen'''|| || they come (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) vienen''' || || you come (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || you (formal, singular, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || them (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || you (formal, plural, m./f.) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''conocer''' || {{SbcInf}} || to know (a person) |- |align="right"| '''(yo) conozco''' || {{SbcPT}} || I know |- |align="right"| '''(tú) conoces''' || || you know (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) conoce''' || || he/she(/it) knows |- |align="right"| '''(usted) conoce''' || || you know (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) conocemos'''|| || we know (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) conocéis'''|| || you know (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) conocen'''|| || they know (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) conocen''' || || you know (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Ahí viene el vecino.''' | Here comes the neighbor. | '''¿Lo conoces?''' | Do you know him? | '''No, no lo conozco. ¿Y tú?''' | No, I don't know him. How about you? | '''Tampoco.''' | Me neither. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Ahí viene el vecino.''' | Here comes the neighbor. | '''¿Lo conoces?''' | Do you know him? | '''No, no lo conozco. ¿Y tú?''' | No, I don't know him. How about you? | '''Tampoco.''' | Me neither. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Here comes the neighbor. | '''Ahí viene el vecino.''' | Do you know him? | '''¿Lo conoces?''' | No, I don't know him. How about you? | '''No, no lo conozco. ¿Y tú?''' | Me neither. | '''(Yo) tampoco.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Here comes the neighbor. | '''Ahí viene el vecino.''' | Do you know him? | '''¿Lo conoces?''' | No, I don't know him. How about you? | '''No, no lo conozco. ¿Y tú?''' | Me neither. | '''(Yo) tampoco.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | There the neighbor comes. | '''Ahí el vecino viene.''' | I don't know him. Do you know him? | '''No lo conozco. ¿Lo conoces?''' | I don't know him either. | '''No lo conozco tampoco.''' | And the (female) neighbor? | '''¿Y la vecina?''' | I don't know her. What about you? | '''No la conozco. ¿Y tú? | Neither do I know her. | '''Yo tampoco la conozco.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | There the neighbor comes. | '''Ahí el vecino viene.''' | I don't know him. Do you know him? | '''No lo conozco. ¿Lo conoces?''' | I don't know him either. | '''No lo conozco tampoco.''' | And the (female) neighbor? | '''¿Y la vecina?''' | I don't know her. What about you? | '''No la conozco. ¿Y tú? | Neither do I know her. | '''Yo tampoco la conozco.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Here comes the neighbor. | '''Ahí viene el vecino.''' | Do you know him? (formal) | '''¿Lo conoce?''' | No, I don't know him. How about you? (formal) | '''No, no lo conozco. ¿Y usted?''' | Me neither. | '''(Yo) tampoco.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Here comes the neighbor. | '''Ahí viene el vecino.''' | Do you know him? (formal) | '''¿Lo conoce?''' | No, I don't know him. How about you? (formal) | '''No, no lo conozco. ¿Y usted?''' | Me neither. | '''(Yo) tampoco.''' }}</includeonly>
