page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0030

revision.comment: move audio link to end
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Call back later|id=A0030}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Making a phone call in Spanish can be somewhat challenging. (I'll never forget my first phone call in Spanish; that's for sure.) Thus, the information provided by Liliana and JP in this lesson is particular useful. The keywords are: '''está''' – he/she is (in), '''no está''' – he/she is not (in). {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0011|A0011: Call me]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0027|A0027: The Neighbor]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0131|A0131: I miss them]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Call back later|id=A0030|dialogueid=A0030 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Hola?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Está Mauricio?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''No, no está. Llámalo más tarde.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Muy bien. Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Hola?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''hello'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| Hello? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Está''' || ''' Mauricio?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(he) is (in)'' || ''Mauricio'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| Is Mauricio in? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''No,''' || '''no''' || '''está.''' || '''Llámalo''' || '''más''' || '''tarde.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''no'' || ''not'' || ''(he) is (in)'' || ''call him'' || ''more'' || ''late'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=6| No, he's not in. Call him back later. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Muy''' || '''bien.''' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0030 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''very'' || ''well'' || ''thanks'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Fine. Thank you. |- |}
{{Wikipedia|Special:PrefixIndex/Mauricio}} [[Image:Gandhi telephoning.jpg|thumb|'''llamar''' – to call|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''¿hola?''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || hello? |- || '''estar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be (at a location) |- || '''(él/ella) está''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''Mauricio''' || {{SbcNounM}} || |- || '''no''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || no, not |- || '''llamar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to call |- || '''¡llama!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || you call! (informal, singular) |- || '''lo''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || him, it |- || '''¡llámalo!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || you call him! (informal, singular) |- || '''más''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || more |- || '''tarde''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || late |- || '''más tarde''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || later |- || '''muy''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || very |- || '''bien''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || well |- || '''gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thanks |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}[[Image:Tablesalt2.jpg|thumb|'''salado/salada''' – salty|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''la tarde''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the afternoon |- || '''bonito/bonita''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || pretty |- || '''salado/salada''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || salty |- || '''está bien''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || alright |- || '''la llamada''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the phone call |- || '''se''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || oneself |- || '''llamarse''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to call oneself, to be called |- || '''me''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || myself |- || '''(yo) me llamo''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I call myself, my name is |- || '''¡aló!''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || hello! |- || '''¡bueno!''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || good! |- || '''¡dime!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || tell me! |- || '''¡diga!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || speak! (formal) |- || '''¡dímelo!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || tell it to me! |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''estar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) estoy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) estás''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) está''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) está''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) estamos''' || || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) estáis''' || || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) están''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''llamar'''|| {{SbcInf}} || to call |- |align="right"| '''¡(tú) llama!'''|| {{SbcImp}} || (you) call! (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) llame!''' || || (you) call! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) llamemos!''' || || (let's) call! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) llamad!''' || || (you) call! (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) llamen!'''|| || (you) call! (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || you (formal, singular, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || them (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || you (formal, plural, m./f.) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''decir''' || {{SbcInf}} ||to say |- |align="right"| '''(yo) digo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I say |- |align="right"| '''(tú) dices''' || || you say (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) dice''' || || he/she(/it) says |- |align="right"| '''(usted) dice''' || || you say (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) decimos''' || || we say (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) decís''' || || you say (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) dicen''' || || they say (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) dicen''' || || you say (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>Translate from English to Spanish. Click each bar to check your answer.</noinclude><includeonly>Cover the right column, translate from English to Spanish and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers.</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== {{SbcQuestion | '''¿Hola?''' | Hello? | '''¿Está Mauricio?''' | Is Mauricio in? | '''No, no está. Llámalo más tarde.''' | No, he's not in. Call him back later. | '''Muy bien. Gracias.''' | Fine. Thank you. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Hola?''' | Hello? | '''¿Está Mauricio?''' | Is Mauricio in? | '''No, no está. Llámalo más tarde.''' | No, he's not in. Call him back later. | '''Muy bien. Gracias.''' | Fine. Thank you. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== {{SbcQuestion | Hello? | '''¿Hola?''' | Is Mauricio in? | '''¿Está Mauricio?''' | No, he's not in. Call him back later. | '''No, no está. Llámalo más tarde.''' | Fine. Thanks. | '''Muy bien. Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hello? | '''¿Hola?''' | Is Mauricio in? | '''¿Está Mauricio?''' | No, he's not in. Call him back later. | '''No, no está. Llámalo más tarde.''' | Fine. Thanks. | '''Muy bien. Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== {{SbcQuestion | Tell me! | '''¡Dime!''' | Hello? | '''¿Hola?''' | Hello! Tell it to me! | '''¡Hola! ¡Dímelo!''' | Mauricio? | '''¿Mauricio?''' | No, Mauricio is not in. | '''No, Mauricio no está.''' | Mauricio is not in? | '''¿No está Mauricio?''' | No, he's not in. Call him back later. | '''No, no está. Llámalo más tarde.''' | Alright. Thanks. | '''Muy bien/está bien. Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== {{SbcQuestionPrint | Tell me! | '''¡Dime!''' | Hello? | '''¿Hola?''' | Hello! Tell it to me! | '''¡Hola! ¡Dímelo!''' | Mauricio? | '''¿Mauricio?''' | No, Mauricio is not in. | '''No, Mauricio no está.''' | Mauricio is not in? | '''¿No está Mauricio?''' | No, he's not in. Call him back later. | '''No, no está. Llámalo más tarde.''' | Alright. Thanks. | '''Muy bien/está bien. Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Hello? | '''¿Hola?''' | Is Ana in? | '''¿Está Ana?''' | No, she's not in. Call her back later. | '''No, no está. Llámala más tarde.''' | Fine. Thank you. | '''Muy bien. Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hello? | '''¿Hola?''' | Is Ana in? | '''¿Está Ana?''' | No, she's not in. Call her back later. | '''No, no está. Llámala más tarde.''' | Fine. Thank you. | '''Muy bien. Gracias.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=It's Expensive|id=A0033}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Beware! This is the taboo lesson: rents, salaries, politics, religion, sex, and ... mamas! Liliana and JP give invaluable information about US-American and Latin-American culture. The keywords are: '''cara''' – expensive (for feminine nouns) and '''caro''' – expensive (for masculine nouns). {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0013|A0013: Doing the laundry]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0037|A0037: The baby is sleeping]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0062|A0062: At the bank]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=It's expensive|id=A0033|dialogueid=A0033 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mi renta es de mil dólares.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿En serio? Es muy cara.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Pero todo es caro.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Tienes razón.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mi''' || '''renta''' || '''es''' || '''de''' || '''mil''' || '''dólares.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''my'' || ''rent'' || ''is'' || ''of'' || ''thousand'' || ''dollars'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=6| My rent is at a thousand dollars. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿En''' || '''serio?''' || '''Es''' || '''muy''' || '''cara.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''in'' || ''serious'' || ''(it) is'' || ''very'' || ''expensive'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| Seriously? It's very expensive. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Pero''' || '''todo''' || '''es''' || '''caro'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''but'' || ''everything'' || ''is'' || ''expensive'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| But everything is expensive. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Tienes''' || '''razón.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0033 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(you) have'' || ''right'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| You're right. |- |}
[[Image:United States one dollar bill, obverse.jpg|thumb|'''el dólar''' – the dollar|160px]] [[Image:1000 USD note; series of 1934; obverse.jpg|thumb|'''mil dólares''' – one thousand dollars|160px]] [[Image:Addesso opie.svg|thumb|'''la cara''' – the face|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''mi''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || my |- || '''la renta''' || {{SbcNounF}}|| the rent |- || '''ser''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) es''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''mil''' || {{SbcNumber}} || thousand |- || '''el dólar''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the dollar |- || '''los dólares''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the dollars |- || '''en''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || in |- || '''serio/seria''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || serious |- || '''muy''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || very |- || '''caro/cara''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || expensive |- || '''pero''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || but |- || '''todo''' || {{SbcPronoun}} || everything, all |- || '''tener''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to have |- || '''(tú) tienes''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you have (informal, singular) |- || '''la razón''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the reason |- || '''tener razón''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || to be right |- |}
===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''la cara''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the face |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''mi''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || my |- |align="right"| '''mis''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || my |- |align="right"| '''tu''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''tus''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || your (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''su''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || his/her(/its)/their |- |align="right"| '''sus''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || his/her(/its)/their |- |align="right"| '''su''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (formal) |- |align="right"| '''sus''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || your (formal) |- |align="right"| '''nuestro/nuestra''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveMF}} || our |- |align="right"| '''nuestros/nuestras''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectivePMF}} || our |- |align="right"| '''vuestro/vuestra''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveMF}} || your (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''vuestros/vuestras''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectivePMF}} || your (informal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''ser''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) soy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) eres''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) es''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) es''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) somos'''|| || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) sois'''|| || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) son'''|| || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) son''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''tener''' || {{SbcInf}} || to have |- |align="right"| '''(yo) tengo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I have |- |align="right"| '''(tú) tienes''' || || you have (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) tiene''' || || he/she(/it) has |- |align="right"| '''(usted) tiene''' || || you have (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) tenemos'''|| || we have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) tenéis'''|| || you have (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) tienen'''|| || they have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) tienen''' || || you have (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Mi renta es de mil dólares.''' | My rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''¿En serio? Es muy cara.''' | Seriously? It's very expensive. | '''Pero todo es caro.''' | But everything is expensive. | '''Tienes razón.''' | You're right. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Mi renta es de mil dólares.''' | My rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''¿En serio? Es muy cara.''' | Seriously? It's very expensive. | '''Pero todo es caro.''' | But everything is expensive. | '''Tienes razón.''' | You're right. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | My rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''Mi renta es de mil dólares.''' | Seriously? It's very expensive. | '''¿En serio? Es muy cara.''' | But everything is expensive. | '''Pero todo es caro.''' | You're right. | '''Tienes razón.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | My rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''Mi renta es de mil dólares.''' | Seriously? It's very expensive. | '''¿En serio? Es muy cara.''' | But everything is expensive. | '''Pero todo es caro.''' | You're right. | '''Tienes razón.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Everything is very expensive. | '''Todo es muy caro.''' | You are right. My rent is very expensive. | '''Tienes razón. Mi renta es muy caro.''' | Everything. | '''Todo.''' | My rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''Mi renta es de mil dólares.''' | That is very, very expensive. | '''Es muy, muy caro.''' | Seriously? | '''¿En serio?''' | Seriously! But everything is very expensive. | '''¡En serio! Pero todo es muy caro.''' | Everything. | '''Todo.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Everything is very expensive. | '''Todo es muy caro.''' | You are right. My rent is very expensive. | '''Tienes razón. Mi renta es muy caro.''' | Everything. | '''Todo.''' | My rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''Mi renta es de mil dólares.''' | That is very, very expensive. | '''Es muy, muy caro.''' | Seriously? | '''¿En serio?''' | Seriously! But everything is very expensive. | '''¡En serio! Pero todo es muy caro.''' | Everything. | '''Todo.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Our rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''Nuestra renta es de mil dólares.''' | Seriously? It's very expensive. | '''¿En serio? Es muy cara.''' | But everything is expensive. | '''Pero todo es caro.''' | You're right. (formal) | '''Tiene razón.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Our rent is at a thousand dollars. | '''Nuestra renta es de mil dólares.''' | Seriously? It's very expensive. | '''¿En serio? Es muy cara.''' | But everything is expensive. | '''Pero todo es caro.''' | You're right. (formal) | '''Tiene razón.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.comment: moved link to audio to end of line
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Is Anyone in There?|id=A0035}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} You never know who is in a bathroom! Thus, better check before you enter. JP and Liliana talk about how to do this and all the other things that can happen in Mexican bathrooms ... The key sentence is: '''está ocupado''' – it's busy/someone's in here. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0013|A0013: Doing the laundry]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0062|A0062: At the bank]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0102|A0102: Where is the restroom?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Is anyone in there?|id=A0035|dialogueid=A0035 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Está ocupado.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0035 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Ah, disculpe.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0035 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''No hay problema. Puede pasar.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0035 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Está''' || '''ocupado.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0035 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(it) is'' || ''busy'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| It's busy. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Ah,''' || '''disculpe.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0035 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''oh'' || ''(you) pardon (me)'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| Oh, sorry. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''No''' || '''hay''' || '''problema.''' || '''Puede''' || '''pasar.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0035 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''not'' || ''there is'' || ''problem'' || ''(you) can'' || ''pass'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| There's no problem. You can go in. |- |}
[[Image:Door Knob with Lock USA.jpg|thumb|'''ocupado/ocupada''' – busy|120px]] [[Image:Toilet women.svg|thumb|'''las damas''' – the ladies|80px]] [[Image:Aiga toiletsq men.svg|thumb|'''los caballeros''' – the gentlemen|80px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''estar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''ocupar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to occupy |- || '''ocupado''' || {{SbcVerbPart}} || occupied |- || '''ocupado/ocupada''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || busy, taken |- || '''ah''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || oh |- || '''disculpar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to pardon |- || '''¡(usted) disculpe!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || you pardon! (formal, singular) |- || '''no''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || not |- || '''hay''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || there is, there are |- || '''el problema''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the problem |- || '''poder''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be able |- || '''(usted) puede''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you can (formal, singular) |- || '''pasar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to pass |- || '''(usted) puede pasar''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || you can go ahead |- |}
===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''el baño''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the bathroom |- || '''comer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to eat |- || '''bailar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to dance |- || '''vomitar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to vomit |- || '''la dama''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the lady |- || '''las damas''' || {{SbcNounPF}} || the ladies |- || '''el caballero''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the gentleman |- || '''los caballeros''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the gentlemen |- || '''¿está ocupado?''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || is it busy/taken? |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''estar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) estoy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) estás''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) está''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) está''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) estamos''' || || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) estáis''' || || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) están''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''disculpar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to pardon |- |align="right"| '''¡(tú) disculpa!'''|| {{SbcImp}} || (you) pardon! (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) disculpe!''' || || (you) pardon! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) disculpemos!''' || || (let's) pardon! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) disculpad!''' || || (you) pardon! (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) disculpen!'''|| || (you) pardon! (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''poder''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be able |- |align="right"| '''(yo) puedo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I can |- |align="right"| '''(tú) puedes''' || || you can (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) puede''' || || he/she(/it) can |- |align="right"| '''(usted) puede''' || || you can (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) podemos''' || || we can (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) podéis''' || || you can (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) pueden''' || || they can (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) pueden''' || || you can (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Está ocupado.''' | It's busy. | '''Ah, disculpe.''' | Oh, sorry. | '''No hay problema. Puede pasar.''' | There's no problem. You can go in. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Está ocupado.''' | It's busy. | '''Ah, disculpe.''' | Oh, sorry. | '''No hay problema. Puede pasar.''' | There's no problem. You can go in. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | It's busy. | '''Está ocupado.''' | Oh, sorry. (formal) | '''Ah, disculpe.''' | There's no problem. You can go in. (formal) | '''No hay problema. Puede pasar.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | It's busy. | '''Está ocupado.''' | Oh, sorry. (formal) | '''Ah, disculpe.''' | There's no problem. You can go in. (formal) | '''No hay problema. Puede pasar.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Is the bathroom busy? | '''¿El baño está ocupado?''' | It's busy! | '''¡Está ocupado!''' | No problem. | '''No hay problema.''' | You cannot enter! (formal) | '''¡No puede pasar!''' | Oh, sorry! (formal) | '''Ah, disculpe.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Is the bathroom busy? | '''¿El baño está ocupado?''' | It's busy! | '''¡Está ocupado!''' | No problem. | '''No hay problema.''' | You cannot enter! (formal) | '''¡No puede pasar!''' | Oh, sorry! (formal) | '''Ah, disculpe.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | It's busy. | '''Está ocupado.''' | Oh, sorry. (informal) | '''Ah, disculpa.''' | There's no problem. You can go in. (informal) | '''No hay problema. Puedes pasar.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | It's busy. | '''Está ocupado.''' | Oh, sorry. (informal) | '''Ah, disculpa.''' | There's no problem. You can go in. (informal) | '''No hay problema. Puedes pasar.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=The Baby Is Sleeping|id=A0037}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Sh! Don't make that much noise when reading this! And don't miss Liliana and JP talking about babys, prohibitive commands, and kids in general. And don't forget to listen for the keyword: '''ruido''' – the noise. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0013|A0013: Doing the laundry]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0033|A0033: It's expensive]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0035|A0035: Is anyone in there?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=The baby is sleeping|id=A0037|dialogueid=A0037 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Sh! ¡No hagas ruido!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Por qué?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''El bebé está dormido.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡No te preocupes!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Sh!''' || '''¡No''' || ''' hagas''' || ''' ruido!''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''sh'' || ''not'' || ''(you) make'' || ''noise'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| Sh! Don't make noise! |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Por qué?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''why'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| Why? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''El''' || '''bebé''' || '''está''' || '''dormido.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''the'' || ''baby'' || ''is'' || ''sleeping'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| The baby is sleeping. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡No''' || '''te''' || '''preocupes!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0037 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''no'' || ''yourself'' || ''worry'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Don't worry. |- |}

(informal, singular) |- || '''el ruido''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the noise |- || '''¿por qué?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || why? |- || '''el bebé/la bebé''' || {{SbcNounMF}} || the baby |- || '''estar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) está''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''dormir''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to sleep |- || '''dormido/dormida''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || asleep |- || '''se''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || oneself |- || '''preocuparse''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to worry (oneself) |- || '''te''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || yourself |- || '''¡(tú) no te preocupes!''' || {{SbcVerbNegImp}} || (you) don't worry (yourself)! |- |}
[[Image:Cambodia4kidsorg - Creative Commons (by).jpg|thumb|right|'''los chicos''' – the kids|120px]] [[Image:Signo Itzcuintli.png|thumb|right|'''el escuincle/la escuincla''' – the skinny dog|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''el silencio''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the silence |- || '''suave''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || soft |- || '''el niño/la niña''' || {{SbcNounMF}} || the child |- || '''los niños/las niñas''' || {{SbcNounPMF}} || the children |- || '''el chico/la chica''' || {{SbcNounMF}} || the boy/the girl |- || '''los chicos/las chicas''' || {{SbcNounPMF}} || the kids/the girls |- || '''el pequeño/la pequeña''' || {{SbcNounMF}} || the little one |- || '''los pequeños/las pequeñas''' || {{SbcNounPMF}} || the little ones |- || '''el mocoso/la mocosa''' || {{SbcNounMF}} || the snotty one |- || '''los mocosos/las mocosas''' || {{SbcNounPMF}} || the snotty ones |- || '''el chilpayate/la chilpayata''' || {{SbcNounMF}} || the little child (Mexican) |- || '''el escuincle/la escuincla''' || {{SbcNounMF}} || the skinny dog (Aztec) |- || '''los/las escuincles''' || {{SbcNounPMF}} || the skinny dogs (Aztec) |- || '''¿dónde?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || where? |- || '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || they are |- || '''¿Dónde están los escuincles?''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || Where are the little dogs? |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''hacer''' || {{SbcInf}} || to make |- |align="right"| '''¡(tú) no hagas!''' || {{SbcNegImp}} || (you) don't make! (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) no haga!''' || || (you) don't make! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) no hagamos!''' || || (let's) don't make! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) no hagáis!''' || || (you) don't make! (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) no hagan!''' || || (you) don't make! (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''estar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) estoy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) estás''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) está''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) está''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) estamos''' || || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) estáis''' || || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) están''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || myself |- |align="right"| '''te''' || || yourself (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || himself/herself(/itself) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || yourself (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos''' || || ourselves, each other |- |align="right"| '''os''' || || yourselves, each other (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || themselves, each other |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || yourselves, each other (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''preocuparse''' || {{SbcInf}} || to worry (oneself) |- |align="right"| '''¡(tú) no te preocupes!''' || {{SbcNegImp}} || (you) don't worry (yourself)! (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) no se preocupe!''' || || (you) don't worry! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) no nos preocupemos!''' || || (let's) don't worry! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) no os preocupéis!''' || || (you) don't worry! (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) no se preocupen!''' || || (you) don't worry! (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¡Sh! ¡No hagas ruido!''' | Sh! Don't make noise! | '''¿Por qué?''' | Why? | '''El bebé está dormido.''' | The baby is sleeping. | '''¡No te preocupes!''' | Don't worry. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¡Sh! ¡No hagas ruido!''' | Sh! Don't make noise! | '''¿Por qué?''' | Why? | '''El bebé está dormido.''' | The baby is sleeping. | '''¡No te preocupes!''' | Don't worry. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Sh! Don't make noise! | '''¡Sh! ¡No hagas ruido!''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | The baby is sleeping. | '''El bebé está dormido.''' | Don't worry. | '''¡No te preocupes!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Sh! Don't make noise! | '''¡Sh! ¡No hagas ruido!''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | The baby is sleeping. | '''El bebé está dormido.''' | Don't worry. | '''¡No te preocupes!''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Is the baby asleep? | '''¿El bebé está dormido?''' | No, it's not asleep. | '''No, no está dormido.''' | Why not? | '''¿Por qué no?''' | Because of ({{=}} por) the noise. | '''¡Por el ruido!''' | Don't make noise! | '''¡No hagas ruido!''' | Don't worry! The baby is asleep. | '''¡No te preocupes! El bebé está dormido.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Is the baby asleep? | '''¿El bebé está dormido?''' | No, it's not asleep. | '''No, no está dormido.''' | Why not? | '''¿Por qué no?''' | Because of ({{=}} por) the noise. | '''¡Por el ruido!''' | Don't make noise! | '''¡No hagas ruido!''' | Don't worry! The baby is asleep. | '''¡No te preocupes! El bebé está dormido.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Sh! Don't make noise! (formal) | '''¡Sh! ¡No haga ruido!''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | The babys are sleeping. | '''Los bebés están dormidos.''' | Don't worry. (formal) | '''¡No se preocupe!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Sh! Don't make noise! (formal) | '''¡Sh! ¡No haga ruido!''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | The babys are sleeping. | '''Los bebés están dormidos.''' | Don't worry. (formal) | '''¡No se preocupe!''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Cheers!|id=A0041}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Here is a true story: the first time I tried to say “cheers” in Spanish, I said “que aproveche,” which means “enjoy your meal” and is just wrong when everyone is drinking instead of eating. Well, it's from our mistakes that we learn. And from JP and Liliana, of course. The keyword of this lesson is: '''felicidades''' – congratulations. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0001|A0001: Are you ready yet?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0003|A0003: At the bar]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0015|A0015: Table for two]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Cheers!|id=A0041|dialogueid=A0041 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Toma una copa!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Por qué brindamos?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Por mi nuevo trabajo.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Felicidades!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Salud!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Salud!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 6}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Toma''' || '''una''' || '''copa!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(you) take'' || ''a'' || ''drink'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Take a drink! |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Por qué''' || ''' brindamos?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''why'' || ''(we) toast'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| What are we toasting to? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Por''' || '''mi''' || ''' nuevo''' || ''' trabajo.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''to'' || ''my'' || ''new'' || ''job'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| To my new job. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Felicidades!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''congratulations'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=1| Congratulations! |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Salud!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''health'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| Cheers! |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Salud!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0041 line 6}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''health'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=1| Cheers! |- |}
[[Image:PS Krøyer - Hip hip hurra! Kunstnerfest på Skagen 1888.jpg|thumb|'''brindar''' – to toast|160px]] [[Image:Glass of champagne.jpg|thumb|'''la copa''' – the drink|80px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''tomar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to take, drink |- || '''(tú) toma''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || (you) take! (informal, singular) |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''la copa''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the drink |- || '''¿por qué?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || why? |- || '''brindar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to toast |- || '''(nosotros/-as) brindamos''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || we toast |- || '''por''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || to, for, because of |- || '''mi''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || my |- || '''nuevo/nueva''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || new |- || '''el trabajo''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the job, the work |- || '''¡felicidades!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || congratulations! |- || '''¡salud!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || cheers! |- || '''la salud''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the health |- |}
[[Image:Asclepius staff.svg|thumb|'''la salud''' – the health|60px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''querer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to want |- || '''(tú) quieres''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you want (informal, singular) |- || '''¿Quieres una copa?''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || Do you want a drink? |- || '''feliz''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || happy |- || '''¡arriba, abajo, al centro, pa' dentro!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || up, down, to the center, inside! |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}

{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¡Toma una copa!''' | Take a drink! | '''¿Por qué brindamos?''' | What are we toasting to? | '''Por mi nuevo trabajo.''' | To my new job. | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¡Toma una copa!''' | Take a drink! | '''¿Por qué brindamos?''' | What are we toasting to? | '''Por mi nuevo trabajo.''' | To my new job. | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Take a drink! | '''¡Toma una copa!''' | What are we toasting to? | '''¿Por qué brindamos?''' | To my new job. | '''Por mi nuevo trabajo.''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Take a drink! | '''¡Toma una copa!''' | What are we toasting to? | '''¿Por qué brindamos?''' | To my new job. | '''Por mi nuevo trabajo.''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Do you want a drink? Take (it)! | '''¿Quieres una copa? ¡Toma!''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | We drink to my new job. | '''Brindamos por mi nuevo trabajo.''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you want a drink? Take (it)! | '''¿Quieres una copa? ¡Toma!''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | We drink to my new job. | '''Brindamos por mi nuevo trabajo.''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Take a drink! (formal) | '''¡Tome una copa (usted)!''' | What are you toasting to? (formal) | '''¿Por qué brinda (usted)?''' | To your new job. (formal) | '''Por su nuevo trabajo.''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Take a drink! (formal) | '''¡Tome una copa (usted)!''' | What are you toasting to? (formal) | '''¿Por qué brinda (usted)?''' | To your new job. (formal) | '''Por su nuevo trabajo.''' | Congratulations! | '''¡Felicidades!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' | Cheers! | '''¡Salud!''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Coffee Time|id=A0047}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Finally! JP and Liliana reveal the secret of Leo's coffee: a little bit of '''leche''' – milk, which is also our keyword. Moreover, we learn about Mexican coffee culture. Mmm! {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0007|A0007: Where are you from?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0023|A0023: Going to the market]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0052|A0052: Smells good]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Coffee time|id=A0047|dialogueid=A0047 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Oye! ¿Te apetece un café?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Claro que sí.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Solo o con leche?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Con un poco de leche, por favor.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Oye!''' || '''¿Te''' || '''apetece''' || '''un''' || '''café?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''hear'' || ''(to) you'' || ''(it) appetizes'' || ''a'' || ''coffee'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| Hey! Do you want a coffee? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Claro''' || '''que''' || '''sí.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''clearly'' || ''that'' || ''yes'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| Of course yes. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Solo''' || '''o''' || '''con''' || '''leche?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''alone'' || ''or'' || ''with'' || ''milk'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| Black or with milk? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Con''' || '''un''' || '''poco''' || '''de''' || '''leche,''' || '''por favor.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0047 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''with'' || ''a'' || ''little bit'' || ''of'' || ''milk'' || ''please'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=6| With a little bit of milk, please. |- |}
[[Image:A small cup of coffee.JPG|thumb|right|'''el café''' – the cup of coffee|160px]] [[Image:Milk glass.jpg|thumb|right|'''la leche''' – the milk|120px]] [[Image:Girl in chiapas.jpg|thumb|right|'''mujer en Chiapas''' – woman in Chiapas (Mexico)|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''oír''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to hear |- || '''¡(tú) oye!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || (you) listen! (informal, singular) |- || '''te''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) you (informal, singular) |- || '''apetecer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to appetize |- || '''(él/ella) apetece''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) appetizes |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''el café''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the (cup of) coffee |- || '''claro''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || clearly |- || '''que''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || that |- || '''sí''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || yes |- || '''solo/sola''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || alone |- || '''o''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || or |- || '''con''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || with |- || '''la leche''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the milk |- || '''un poco''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || a little bit |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''un poco de leche''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || a little bit of milk |- || '''por favor''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || please |- |}
{{Wikipedia|Chiapas}} {{Wikipedia|Antigua, Guatemala}}{{Wikipedia|Veracruz, Veracruz}} ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''negro/negra''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || black |- || '''café negro''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || black coffee |- || '''café solo''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || black coffee |- || '''querer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to want |- || '''(él/ella) quiere''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) wants |- || '''Colombia''' || {{SbcNounF}}|| Colombia |- || '''café suave''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || smooth coffee |- || '''México/Méjico''' || {{SbcNounM}} || Mexico |- || '''Chiapas''' || {{SbcNounPM}}|| Chiapas (a Mexican state) |- || '''Antigua''' || {{SbcNounF}} || Antigua (city in Guatemala) |- || '''Guatemala''' || {{SbcNounF}} || Guatemala |- || '''la parroquia''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the parish (church) |- || '''café de la parroquia''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || coffee of the parish |- || '''Veracruz''' || {{SbcNounF}} || Veracruz (city in Mexico) |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |- |align="right"| '''oír''' || {{SbcInf}} || to hear |- |align="right"| '''¡(tú) oye!''' || {{SbcImp}} || (you) hear! (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) oiga!''' || || (you) hear! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) oigamos!''' || || (let's) hear! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) oíd!''' || || (you) hear! (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) oigan!''' || || (you) hear! (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || (to) you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) you (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || (to) us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || (to) you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) them |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) you (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''apetecer''' || {{SbcInf}} || to appetize |- |align="right"| '''(yo) apetezco''' || {{SbcPT}} || I appetize |- |align="right"| '''(tú) apeteces''' || || you appetize (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) apetece''' || || he/she(/it) appetizes |- |align="right"| '''(usted) apetece''' || || you appetize (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) apetecemos''' || || we appetize (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) apetecéis''' || || you appetize (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) apetecen''' || || they appetize (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) apetecen''' || || you appetize (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''querer''' || {{SbcInf}} || to want |- |align="right"| '''(yo) quiero''' || {{SbcPT}} || I want |- |align="right"| '''(tú) quieres''' || || you want (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) quiere''' || || he/she(/it) wants |- |align="right"| '''(usted) quiere''' || || you want (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) queremos'''|| || we want (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) queréis'''|| || you want (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) quieren'''|| || they want (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) quieren''' || || you want (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¡Oye! ¿Te apetece un café?''' | Hey! Do you want a coffee? | '''Claro que sí.''' | Of course yes. | '''¿Solo o con leche?''' | Black or with milk? | '''Con un poco de leche, por favor.''' | With a little bit of milk, please. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¡Oye! ¿Te apetece un café?''' | Hey! Do you want a coffee? | '''Claro que sí.''' | Of course yes. | '''¿Solo o con leche?''' | Black or with milk? | '''Con un poco de leche, por favor.''' | With a little bit of milk, please. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Hey! Do you want a coffee? | '''¡Oye! ¿Te apetece un café?''' | Of course yes. | '''Claro que sí.''' | Black or with milk? | '''¿Solo o con leche?''' | With a little bit of milk, please. | '''Con un poco de leche, por favor.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hey! Do you want a coffee? | '''¡Oye! ¿Te apetece un café?''' | Of course yes. | '''Claro que sí.''' | Black or with milk? | '''¿Solo o con leche?''' | With a little bit of milk, please. | '''Con un poco de leche, por favor.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Would you like a little bit of milk? | '''¿Te apetece un poco de leche?''' | Coffee with milk? | '''¿Café con leche?''' | Of course. One coffee with milk. | '''Claro. Un café con leche.''' | Hey! | '''¡Oye!''' | Yes? | '''¿Sí?''' | A black coffee, please. | '''Un café solo, por favor.''' | You would like a black coffee? | '''¿Te apetece un café solo?''' | Of course yes. | '''Claro que sí.''' | Of course. | '''Claro.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Would you like a little bit of milk? | '''¿Te apetece un poco de leche?''' | Coffee with milk? | '''¿Café con leche?''' | Of course. One coffee with milk. | '''Claro. Un café con leche.''' | Hey! | '''¡Oye!''' | Yes? | '''¿Sí?''' | A black coffee, please. | '''Un café solo, por favor.''' | You would like a black coffee? | '''¿Te apetece un café solo?''' | Of course yes. | '''Claro que sí.''' | Of course. | '''Claro.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Hey! Do you want a coffee? (formal) | '''¡Oiga! ¿Le apetece un café?''' | Of course yes. | '''Claro que sí.''' | Black or with milk? | '''¿Solo o con leche?''' | With a little bit of milk, please. | '''Con un poco de leche, por favor.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hey! Do you want a coffee? (formal) | '''¡Oiga! ¿Le apetece un café?''' | Of course yes. | '''Claro que sí.''' | Black or with milk? | '''¿Solo o con leche?''' | With a little bit of milk, please. | '''Con un poco de leche, por favor.''' }}</includeonly>

page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0052

revision.comment: moved link to audio to end of line
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Smells Good|id=A0052}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} If you are on a diet, you might want to skip this lesson. Seriously! Otherwise you are about to listen to the most sensual dialogue of this course. Our keywords are: '''qué rico''' – how delicious and '''cuidado''' – caution/be careful. Have the cookies ready! {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0047|A0047: Coffee time]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0106|A0106: Room service]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0116|A0116: Do you want a mint?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Smells good|id=A0052|dialogueid=A0052 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Huele bien.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Sí, son mis galletas.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Qué rico!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Cuidado, están calientes!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Huele''' || ''' bien.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(it) smells'' || ''well'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| It smells good. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Sí,''' || ''' son''' || '''mis''' || '''galletas.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''yes'' || ''(they) are'' || ''my'' || ''cookies'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| Yes, it's my cookies. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Qué''' || '''rico!''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''how'' || ''rich'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| How delicious! |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Cuidado,''' || '''están''' || '''calientes!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0052 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''caution'' || ''(they) are'' || ''hot'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Careful, they're hot! |- |}
[[Image:Choco chip cookie.jpg|thumb|'''la galleta''' – the cookie|120px]] [[Image:VegasBitch198.jpg|thumb|'''rico/rica''' – rich|120px]] [[Image:Gefahrenzeichen 16.svg|thumb|'''¡cuidado!''' – be careful|120px]] [[Image:Delicious bikini-girl silvia.jpg|thumb|'''caliente''' – hot|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''oler''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to smell |- || '''(él/ella) huele''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) smells |- || '''bien''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || well |- || '''sí''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || yes |- || '''ser''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be (permanent nature) |- || '''(ellos/ellas) son''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || they are |- || '''mi''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || my |- || '''mis''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || my |- || '''la galleta''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the cookie |- || '''las galletas''' || {{SbcNounPF}} || the cookies |- || '''mi galleta''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || my cookie |- || '''mis galletas''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || my cookies |- || '''¿qué?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || what?, how? |- || '''rico/rica''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || rich, delicious |- || '''el cuidado''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the caution |- || '''¡cuidado!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || caution!, be careful! |- || '''estar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be (temporary state) |- || '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || they are |- || '''caliente''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || hot |- || '''calientes''' || {{SbcAdjectivePMF}}|| hot |- |}
[[Image:French Kiss.JPG|thumb|'''el beso''' – the kiss|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''(él/ella) es''' || {{SbcVerbPT}}|| he/she(/it) is |- || '''(él) es rico''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || he is rich |- || '''(ella) es rica''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || she is rich |- || '''(él/ella) está''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''(él) está rico''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || he(/it) is delicious |- || '''(ella) está rica''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || she(/it) is delicious |- || '''el masaje''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the massage |- || '''¡qué rico masaje!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || what a pleasant massage! |- || '''el beso''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the kiss |- || '''¡qué rico beso!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || what an awesome kiss! |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}

{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Huele bien.''' | It smells good. | '''Sí, son mis galletas.''' | Yes, it's my cookies. | '''¡Qué rico!''' | How delicious! | '''¡Cuidado, están calientes!''' | Careful, they're hot! }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Huele bien.''' | It smells good. | '''Sí, son mis galletas.''' | Yes, it's my cookies. | '''¡Qué rico!''' | How delicious! | '''¡Cuidado, están calientes!''' | Careful, they're hot! }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | It smells good. | '''Huele bien.''' | Yes, it's my cookies. | '''Sí, son mis galletas.''' | How delicious! | '''¡Qué rico!''' | Careful, they're hot! | '''¡Cuidado, están calientes!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | It smells good. | '''Huele bien.''' | Yes, it's my cookies. | '''Sí, son mis galletas.''' | How delicious! | '''¡Qué rico!''' | Careful, they're hot! | '''¡Cuidado, están calientes!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | It smells good. Is it cookies? | '''Huele bien. ¿Son galletas?''' | Yes, it's my hot cookies. | '''Sí, son mis galletas calientes.''' | Are they hot? | '''¿Están calientes?''' | Yes, they are hot. Careful! | '''Sí, están calientes. ¡Cuidado!''' | How hot! | '''¡Qué caliente!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | It smells good. Is it cookies? | '''Huele bien. ¿Son galletas?''' | Yes, it's my hot cookies. | '''Sí, son mis galletas calientes.''' | Are they hot? | '''¿Están calientes?''' | Yes, they are hot. Careful! | '''Sí, están calientes. ¡Cuidado!''' | How hot! | '''¡Qué caliente!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | It smells good. | '''Huele bien.''' | Yes, it's my cookie. | '''Sí, es mi galleta.''' | How delicious! | '''¡Qué rico!''' | Careful, it's hot! | '''¡Cuidado, está caliente!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | It smells good. | '''Huele bien.''' | Yes, it's my cookie. | '''Sí, es mi galleta.''' | How delicious! | '''¡Qué rico!''' | Careful, it's hot! | '''¡Cuidado, está caliente!''' }}</includeonly>

page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0056

revision.comment: moved link to audio to end of line
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=What Time Is the Train?|id=A0056}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Don't panic! Take your time with this lesson! Not only are Liliana and JP talking about a lot of numbers but also about times and hours — including the funny 24-hour system. We learn that JP doesn't like it and even Liliana seems to get it wrong at one point. Anyway, the key phrases are: '''¿Qué hora es?''' – What time is it? and '''¡Apúrate!''' – Hurry up! {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0092|A0092: How old are you?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0112|A0112: What is your telephone number?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0122|A0122: Telephone card]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=What time is the train?|id=A0056|dialogueid=A0056 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿A qué hora sale nuestro tren?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''A las tres de la tarde.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Y qué hora es?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Son las dos cuarenta!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Apúrate! ¡Corre!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿A''' || '''qué''' || '''hora''' || '''sale''' || '''nuestro''' || '''tren?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''at'' || ''what'' || ''hour'' || ''(it) leaves'' || ''our'' || ''train'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=6| At what time does our train leave? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''A''' || '''las''' || '''tres''' || '''de''' || '''la''' || '''tarde.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''at'' || ''the'' || ''three'' || ''of'' || ''the'' || ''afternoon'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=6| At three o'clock in the afternoon. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Y''' || '''qué''' || '''hora''' || '''es?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''and'' || ''what'' || ''hour'' || ''(it) is'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| And what time is it? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Son''' || '''las''' || '''dos''' || '''cuarenta!''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(they) are'' || ''the'' || ''two'' || ''forty'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| It's two forty. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Apúrate!''' || '''¡Corre!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0056 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''hurry (yourself)'' || ''run'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| Hurry up! Run! |- |}
[[Image:The Empire State Express 1893.jpg|thumb|'''el tren''' – the train|160px]] [[Image:Canis rufus FWS cropped.jpg|thumb|'''correr''' – to run|160px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''a''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || at |- || '''¿qué?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || what? |- || '''la hora''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the hour, the time |- || '''salir''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to leave |- || '''(él/ella) sale''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) leaves |- || '''nuestro/nuestra''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveMF}} || our |- || '''el tren''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the train |- || '''tres''' || {{SbcNumber}} || three |- || '''a las tres''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || at three o'clock |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''la tarde''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the afternoon |- || '''y''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || and |- || '''ser''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) es''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''¿Qué hora es?''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || What time is it? |- || '''(ellos/ellas) son''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || they are |- || '''dos''' || {{SbcNumber}} || two |- || '''Son las dos.''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || It's two o'clock. |- || '''cuarenta''' || {{SbcNumber}} || forty |- || '''se''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || oneself |- || '''apurarse''' ||{{SbcVerbInf}} || to hurry up (oneself) |- || '''te''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}}|| yourself (informal, singular) |- || '''¡(tú) apúrate!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || (you) hurry up (yourself)! (informal, singular) |- || '''correr''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to run |- || '''¡(tú) corre!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || (you) run! (informal, singular) |- |}
[[Image:Horloge.svg|thumb|'''las cinco''' – five o'clock|120px]] [[Image:Picswiss BE-98-26 Biel- Uhr am Bahnhof SBB.jpg|thumb|'''las veinte''' – eight o'clock in the evening|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''una e''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || an e |- || '''en''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || in |- || '''la una''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || one o'clock |- || '''es la una''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || it's one o'clock |- || '''a la una''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || at one o'clock |- || '''las dos''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || two o'clock |- || '''son las dos''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || it's two o'clock |- || '''a las dos''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || at two o'clock |- || '''las tres''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || three o'clock |- || '''las cuatro''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || four o'clock |- || '''las cinco''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || five o'clock |- || '''las seis''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || six o'clock |- || '''las siete''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || seven o'clock |- || '''quince''' || {{SbcNumber}} || fifteen |- || '''las quince (horas)''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || three o'clock in the afternoon |- || '''trece''' || {{SbcNumber}} || thirteen |- || '''las trece (horas)''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || one o'clock in the afternoon |- || '''catorce''' || {{SbcNumber}} || fourteen |- || '''las catorce (horas)''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || two o'clock in the afternoon |- || '''dieciséis''' || {{SbcNumber}} || sixteen |- || '''las dieciséis (horas)''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || four o'clock in the afternoon |- || '''veinte''' || {{SbcNumber}} || twenty |- || '''las veinte (horas)''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || eight o'clock in the evening |- || '''ocho''' || {{SbcNumber}} || eight |- || '''¡vamonos!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || let's go! |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}

'''(usted) es''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) somos'''|| || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) sois'''|| || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) || myself |- |align="right"| '''te''' || || yourself (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || himself/herself(/itself) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || yourself (formal, singular) |- {{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¿A qué hora sale nuestro tren?''' | At what time does our train leave? | '''A las tres de la tarde.''' | At three o'clock in the afternoon. | '''¿Y qué hora es?''' | And what time is it? | '''¡Son las dos cuarenta!''' | It's two forty. | '''¡Apúrate! ¡Corre!''' | Hurry up! Run! }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿A qué hora sale nuestro tren?''' | At what time does our train leave? | '''A las tres de la tarde.''' | At three o'clock in the afternoon. | '''¿Y qué hora es?''' | And what time is it? | '''¡Son las dos cuarenta!''' | It's two forty. | '''¡Apúrate! ¡Corre!''' | Hurry up! Run! }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | At what time does our train leave? | '''¿A qué hora sale nuestro tren?''' | At three o'clock in the afternoon. | '''A las tres de la tarde.''' | And what time is it? | '''¿Y qué hora es?''' | It's two forty. | '''¡Son las dos cuarenta!''' | Hurry up! Run! | '''¡Apúrate! ¡Corre!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | At what time does our train leave? | '''¿A qué hora sale nuestro tren?''' | At three o'clock in the afternoon. | '''A las tres de la tarde.''' | And what time is it? | '''¿Y qué hora es?''' | It's two forty. | '''¡Son las dos cuarenta!''' | Hurry up! Run! | '''¡Apúrate! ¡Corre!''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | What time is it? | '''¿Qué hora es?''' | It's one o'clock. | '''Es la una.''' | And at what time does the train leave? | '''¿Y a qué hora sale el tren?''' | Our train leaves at three o'clock in the afternoon. | '''Nuestro tren sale a las tres de la tarde.''' | Hurry up! Run! ''(speaking to a watch)'' | '''¡Apúrate! ¡Corre!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What time is it? | '''¿Qué hora es?''' | It's one o'clock. | '''Es la una.''' | And at what time does the train leave? | '''¿Y a qué hora sale el tren?''' | Our train leaves at three o'clock in the afternoon. | '''Nuestro tren sale a las tres de la tarde.''' | Hurry up! Run! ''(speaking to a watch)'' | '''¡Apúrate! ¡Corre!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | At what time does your train leave? (formal, singular) | '''¿A qué hora sale su tren?''' | At five o'clock in the afternoon. | '''A las cinco de la tarde.''' | And what time is it? | '''¿Y qué hora es?''' | It's four forty. | '''¡Son las cuatro cuarenta!''' | Hurry up! Run! (formal, singular) | '''¡Apúrese! ¡Corra!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | At what time does your train leave? (formal, singular) | '''¿A qué hora sale su tren?''' | At five o'clock in the afternoon. | '''A las cinco de la tarde.''' | And what time is it? | '''¿Y qué hora es?''' | It's four forty. | '''¡Son las cuatro cuarenta!''' | Hurry up! Run! (formal, singular) | '''¡Apúrese! ¡Corra!''' }}</includeonly>
