revision.comment: moved link to audio to end of line
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=At the Bank|id=A0062}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} We are going to a Mexican bank! That must be fun! Well, maybe not that much. But at least we are well prepared after this lesson with Liliana and JP. The keyword is: '''depósito''' – deposit. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0015|A0015: Table for two]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0033|A0033: It's expensive]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0035|A0035: Is anyone in there?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=At the Bank|id=A0062|dialogueid=A0062 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Quiero hacer un depósito.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Llene este formulario!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Me presta su pluma?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Claro.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Quiero''' || '''hacer''' || '''un''' || '''depósito.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(I) want'' || ''(to) make'' || ''a'' || ''deposit'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| I want to make a deposit. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Llene''' || '''este''' || '''formulario!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(you) fill out'' || ''this'' || ''form'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Fill out this form! |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Me''' || '''presta''' || '''su''' || '''pluma?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(to) me'' || ''(you) loan'' || ''your'' || ''pen'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| Do you loan me your pen? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Claro.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0062 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''clear'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| Of course. |- |}
[[Image:Fuellfederhalter.jpg|thumb|'''la pluma''' – the fountain pen|120px]] [[Image:A single white feather closeup.jpg|thumb|'''la pluma''' – the feather|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''querer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to want |- || '''(yo) quiero''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I want |- || '''hacer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to make |- || '''(yo) quiero hacer''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || I want to make |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''el depósito''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the deposit |- || '''llenar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}}|| to fill (up/out) |- || '''¡(usted) llene!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || (you) fill (out)! (formal, singular) |- || '''este/esta''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || this |- || '''el formulario''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the form |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to/for) me |- || '''prestar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to loan |- || '''(usted) presta''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you loan (formal, singular) |- || '''su''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (formal) |- || '''la pluma''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the (fountain) pen, the feather |- || '''claro/clara''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || clear |- || '''¡claro!''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || of course! |- |}
{{Wikipedia|piñata}}{{Wikipedia|mariachi}} ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''¡Llene el vaso de agua!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || Fill up the glass of water! |- || '''¡Llene el tanque!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || Fill the gas tank! |- || '''la señorita''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the miss |- || '''la piñata''' || {{SbcNounF}} || game for children about breaking a pot |- || '''los mariachis''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the Mexican musicians |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}

|align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) prestan''' || || they loan (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) prestan''' || || you loan (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''mi''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || my |- |align="right"| '''mis''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || my |- |align="right"| '''tu''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (informal, singular) |- {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || his/her(/its)/their |- |align="right"| '''su''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (formal) |- |align="right"| '''sus''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || your '''vuestro/vuestra''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveMF}} || your (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''vuestros/vuestras''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectivePMF}} || your (informal, plural) |- |}

If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Quiero hacer un depósito.''' | I want to make a deposit. | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Fill out this form! | '''¿Me presta su pluma?''' | Do you loan me your pen? | '''Claro.''' | Of course. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Quiero hacer un depósito.''' | I want to make a deposit. | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Fill out this form! | '''¿Me presta su pluma?''' | Do you loan me your pen? | '''Claro.''' | Of course. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | I want to make a deposit. | '''Quiero hacer un depósito.''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Do you loan me your pen? | '''¿Me presta su pluma?''' | Of course. | '''Claro.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | I want to make a deposit. | '''Quiero hacer un depósito.''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Do you loan me your pen? | '''¿Me presta su pluma?''' | Of course. | '''Claro.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | I want to make a deposit. | '''Quiero hacer un depósito.''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Of course. Do you loan me your pen? | '''Claro. ¿Me presta su pluma?''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | I want to fill out this form! | '''¡Quiero llenar este formulario!''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Of course. | '''Claro.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | I want to make a deposit. | '''Quiero hacer un depósito.''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Of course. Do you loan me your pen? | '''Claro. ¿Me presta su pluma?''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | I want to fill out this form! | '''¡Quiero llenar este formulario!''' | Fill out this form! | '''¡Llene este formulario!''' | Of course. | '''Claro.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | We want to make a deposit. | '''Queremos hacer un depósito.''' | Fill out this form! revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Bottle of Water|id=A0066}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Ordering a bottle of water is one thing; making fun at the same time is something completely different. JP and Liliana tell us all about it — and more! The keywords are: '''gas''' – carbonation and '''botella''' – bottle. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0003|A0003: At the bar]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0010|A0010: I'm hungry]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0023|A0023: Going to the market]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Bottle of Water|id=A0066|dialogueid=A0066 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Qué le doy?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Me da una botella de agua, por favor?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Agua con gas o sin gas?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Sin gas porque me da gas.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Enseguida se la doy.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 6}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Qué''' || '''le''' || '''doy?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''what'' || ''(to) you'' || ''(I) give'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| What shall I give you? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Me''' || '''da''' || '''una''' || '''botella''' || '''de''' || '''agua,''' || '''por favor?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(to) me'' || ''(you) give'' || ''a'' || ''bottle'' || ''of'' || ''water'' || ''please'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=7| Will you give me a bottle of water, please? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Agua''' || '''con''' || '''gas''' || '''o''' || '''sin''' || '''gas?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''water'' || ''with'' || ''gas'' || ''or'' || ''without'' || ''gas'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=6| Carbonated water or non-carbonated water? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Sin''' || '''gas''' || '''porque''' || '''me''' || '''da''' || '''gas.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''without'' || ''gas'' || ''because'' || ''(to) me'' || ''(it) gives'' || ''gas'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=6| Non-carbonated because it gives me gas. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Enseguida''' || '''se''' || '''la''' || '''doy.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''immediately'' || ''(to) you'' || ''it'' || ''(I) give'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| I'll give it to you right away. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0066 line 6}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''thanks'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=1| Thank you. |- |}
[[Image:Brand Cielo Water Bottle 2.5 Litre.jpg|thumb|'''una botella de agua sin gas''' – a bottle of non-carbonated water|120px]] {{Wikipedia|Agua de Beber}} [[Image:Ice water.jpg|thumb|'''el agua fría''' – the cold water|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''¿qué?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || what? |- || '''le''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) you (formal, singular) |- || '''dar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to give |- || '''(yo) doy''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I give |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- || '''(usted) da''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you give (formal, singular) |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''la botella''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the bottle |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''<u>el a</u>gua''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the water |- || '''por favor''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || please |- || '''con''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || with |- || '''el gas''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the gas, the carbonation |- || '''o''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || or |- || '''sin''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || without |- || '''porque''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || because |- || '''(él/ella) da''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) gives |- || '''enseguida''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || immediately, right away |- || '''la''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || her(/it) |- || '''se la doy''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || I give her(/it) to you (formal, singular) |- || '''gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thanks |- |}
{{Wikipedia|Agua Fria National Monument}} ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''(tú) das''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you give (informal, singular) |- || '''frío/fría''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || cold |- || '''<u>el a</u>gu<u>a</u> frí<u>a</u>''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || the cold water |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''dar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to give |- |align="right"| '''(yo) doy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I give |- |align="right"| '''(tú) das''' || || you give (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) da''' || || he/she(/it) gives |- |align="right"| '''(usted) da''' || || you give (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) damos'''|| || we give (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) dais'''|| || you give (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) dan'''|| || they give (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) dan''' || || you give (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || (to) you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) you (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || (to) us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || (to) you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) them |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) you (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || you (formal, singular, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || them (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || you (formal, plural, m./f.) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to me |- |align="right"| '''te lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''se lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''se lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to you (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to us |- |align="right"| '''os lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''se lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to them |- |align="right"| '''se lo/la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him/her(/it) to you (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¿Qué le doy?''' | What shall I give you? | '''¿Me da una botella de agua, por favor?''' | Will you give me a bottle of water, please? | '''¿Agua con gas o sin gas?''' | Carbonated water or non-carbonated water? | '''Sin gas porque me da gas.''' | Non-carbonated because it gives me gas. | '''Enseguida se la doy.''' | I'll give it to you right away. | '''Gracias.''' | Thank you. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Qué le doy?''' | What shall I give you? | '''¿Me da una botella de agua, por favor?''' | Will you give me a bottle of water, please? | '''¿Agua con gas o sin gas?''' | Carbonated water or non-carbonated water? | '''Sin gas porque me da gas.''' | Non-carbonated because it gives me gas. | '''Enseguida se la doy.''' | I'll give it to you right away. | '''Gracias.''' | Thank you. }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | What shall I give you? | '''¿Qué le doy?''' | Will you give me a bottle of water, please? | '''¿Me da una botella de agua, por favor?''' | Carbonated water or non-carbonated water? | '''¿Agua con gas o sin gas?''' | Non-carbonated because it gives me gas. | '''Sin gas porque me da gas.''' | I'll give it to you right away. | '''Enseguida se la doy.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What shall I give you? | '''¿Qué le doy?''' | Will you give me a bottle of water, please? | '''¿Me da una botella de agua, por favor?''' | Carbonated water or non-carbonated water? | '''¿Agua con gas o sin gas?''' | Non-carbonated because it gives me gas. | '''Sin gas porque me da gas.''' | I'll give it to you right away. | '''Enseguida se la doy.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | What shall I give you? | '''¿Qué le doy?''' | Will you give me a bottle, please? | '''¿Me da una botella, por favor?''' | ¿A bottle? ¿A bottle of water or what? | '''¿Una botella? ¿Una botella de agua o qué?''' | Will you give me a bottle of gas, please? | '''¿Me da una botella de gas, por favor?''' | What? A bottle of carbonated water? | '''¿Qué? ¿Una botella de agua con gas?''' | Or a bottle of gas with water. | '''O una botella de gas con agua.''' | I'll give it to you right away. | '''Enseguida se la doy.''' | I give you the thanks. ({{=}} I thank you) | '''Le doy las gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What shall I give you? | '''¿Qué le doy?''' | Will you give me a bottle, please? | '''¿Me da una botella, por favor?''' | ¿A bottle? ¿A bottle of water or what? | '''¿Una botella? ¿Una botella de agua o qué?''' | Will you give me a bottle of gas, please? | '''¿Me da una botella de gas, por favor?''' | What? A bottle of carbonated water? | '''¿Qué? ¿Una botella de agua con gas?''' | Or a bottle of gas with water. | '''O una botella de gas con agua.''' | I'll give it to you right away. | '''Enseguida se la doy.''' | I give you the thanks. ({{=}} I thank you) | '''Le doy las gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | What shall I give you? (informal) | '''¿Qué te doy?''' | Will you give me a bottle of water, please? (informal) | '''¿Me das una botella de agua, por favor?''' | Carbonated water or non-carbonated water? | '''¿Agua con gas o sin gas?''' | Non-carbonated because it gives me gas. | '''Sin gas porque me da gas.''' | I'll give it to you right away. (informal) | '''Enseguida te la doy.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What shall I give you? (informal) | '''¿Qué te doy?''' | Will you give me a bottle of water, please? (informal) | '''¿Me das una botella de agua, por favor?''' | Carbonated water or non-carbonated water? | '''¿Agua con gas o sin gas?''' | Non-carbonated because it gives me gas. | '''Sin gas porque me da gas.''' | I'll give it to you right away. (informal) | '''Enseguida te la doy.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.comment: moved link to audio to end of line
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Here Is My Card|id=A0072}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} A few Spanish words can make a big difference when you are networking. So does a nice business card, which is also our keyword: '''tarjeta de presentación''' – business card. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0027|A0027: The Neighbor]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0082|A0082: My name is...]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0112|A0112: What is your telephone number?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Here is my card|id=A0072|dialogueid=A0072 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Mucho gusto.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0072 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Igualmente.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0072 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Me puedes dar tu e-mail?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0072 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mejor te doy mi tarjeta de presentación.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0072 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Mucho''' || '''gusto.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0072 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''much'' || ''pleasure'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| It's been my pleasure. |- |}

:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Me''' || '''puedes''' || '''dar''' || '''tu''' || '''e-mail?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0072 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(to) me'' || ''(you) can'' || ''give'' || ''your'' || ''e-mail'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| Can you give me your e-mail? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mejor''' || '''te''' || '''doy''' || '''mi''' || '''tarjeta''' || '''de''' || '''presentación.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0072 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''better'' || ''(to) you'' || ''(I) give'' || ''my'' || ''card'' || ''of'' || ''introduction'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=7| I'll better give you my business card. |- |}
[[Image:Swim texas card.jpg|thumb|'''la tarjeta de presentación''' – the business card|120px]] [[Image:Communication sender-message-reciever.png|thumb|'''la comunicación''' – the communication|120px]] [[Image:Info icon 002.svg|thumb|'''la información''' – the information|80px]] [[Image:Wiki-prostitute.png|thumb|'''la prostitución''' – the prostitution|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''mucho/mucha''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || much |- || '''el gusto''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the pleasure |- || '''igualmente''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || equally, likewise |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to/for) me |- || '''poder''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be able |- || '''(tú) puedes''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you can (informal, singular) |- || '''dar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to give |- || '''(tú) me puedes dar''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || you can give to me (informal, singular) |- || '''tu''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || your (informal, singular) |- || '''el e-mail''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the e-mail |- || '''mejor''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || better |- || '''te''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to/for) you (informal, singular) |- || '''(yo) doy''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I give |- || '''mi''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || my |- || '''la tarjeta''' ||{{SbcNounF}} || the card |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''la presentación''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the introduction |- || '''la tarjeta de presentación''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || the business card |- |}
[[Image:GG Allin Grave.jpg|thumb|'''la drogadicción''' – the drug addiction|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''también''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || also |- || '''la comunicación''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the communication |- || '''la información''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the information |- || '''la transportación''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the transportation |- || '''la prostitución''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the prostitution |- || '''la drogadicción''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the drug addiction |- || '''muchas gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thank you very much |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || (to) you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) '''les'''|| || (to) them |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) you (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''poder''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be able |- |align="right"| '''(yo) puedo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I can |- |align="right"| '''(tú) puedes''' || || you can (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) puede''' || || he/she(/it) can |- |align="right"| '''(usted) puede''' || || you can (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) podemos''' || || we can (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) podéis''' || || you can (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) pueden''' || || they can (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) pueden''' || || you can (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''dar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to give |- |align="right"| '''(yo) doy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I give |- |align="right"| '''(tú) das''' || || you give (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) da''' || || he/she(/it) gives |- |align="right"| '''(usted) da''' || || you give (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) damos'''|| || we give (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) dais'''|| || you give (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) dan'''|| || they give (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) dan''' || || you give (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''mi''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || my |- |align="right"| '''mis''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || my |- |align="right"| '''tu''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''tus''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || your (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''su''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || his/her(/its)/their |- |align="right"| '''sus''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || his/her(/its)/their |- |align="right"| '''su''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (formal) |- |align="right"| '''sus''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveP}} || your (formal) |- |align="right"| '''nuestro/nuestra''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveMF}} || our |- |align="right"| '''nuestros/nuestras''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectivePMF}} || our |- |align="right"| '''vuestro/vuestra''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectiveMF}} || your (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''vuestros/vuestras''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjectivePMF}} || your (informal, plural) |- |}

If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Mucho gusto.''' | It's been my pleasure. | '''Igualmente.''' | Likewise. | '''¿Me puedes dar tu e-mail?''' | Can you give me your e-mail? | '''Mejor te doy mi tarjeta de presentación.''' | I'll better give you my business card. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Mucho gusto.''' | It's been my pleasure. | '''Igualmente.''' | Likewise. | '''¿Me puedes dar tu e-mail?''' | Can you give me your e-mail? | '''Mejor te doy mi tarjeta de presentación.''' | I'll better give you my business card. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | It's been my pleasure. | '''Mucho gusto.''' | Likewise. | '''Igualmente.''' | Can you give me your e-mail? | '''¿Me puedes dar tu e-mail?''' | I'll better give you my business card. | '''Mejor te doy mi tarjeta de presentación.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | It's been my pleasure. | '''Mucho gusto.''' | Likewise. | '''Igualmente.''' | Can you give me your e-mail? | '''¿Me puedes dar tu e-mail?''' | I'll better give you my business card. | '''Mejor te doy mi tarjeta de presentación.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | It's been my pleasure. | '''Mucho gusto.''' | Likewise. I'll give you my e-mail. | '''Igualmente. Te doy mi e-mail.''' | I'll better give you my business card. | '''Mejor te doy mi tarjeta de presentación.''' | Thank you very much. | '''Muchas gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | It's been my pleasure. | '''Mucho gusto.''' | Likewise. page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0076

revision.comment: moved link to audio to end of line
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Jet-Lag|id=A0076}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} The most important thing about jet-lag: there is good jet-lag (when the local time is behind your time because you were flying westwards) and bad jet-lag (when the local time is ahead of your time because you were flying eastwards). Similarly, our keyword has multiple meanings: '''cambio de horario''' – change of schedule/change of time zone/jet-lag. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0016|A0016: I feel sick]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0021|A0021: I'm sleepy]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0131|A0131: I miss them]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Jet-lag|id=A0076|dialogueid=A0076 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Tengo jet-lag.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Qué es eso?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''El cambio de horario.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Ah, claro, porque aquí son ocho horas más.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Cierto.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Tengo''' || ''' jet-lag.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(I) have'' || ''jet-lag'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| I have jet-lag. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Qué''' || '''es''' || '''eso?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''what'' || ''(it) is'' || ''that'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| What's that? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''El''' || '''cambio''' || '''de''' || '''horario.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''the'' || ''change'' || ''of'' || ''schedule'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| The change of time zone. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Ah,''' || '''claro,''' || '''porque''' || '''aquí''' || '''son''' || '''ocho''' || '''horas''' || '''más.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''oh'' || ''clearly'' || ''because'' || ''here'' || ''(they) are'' || ''eight'' || ''hours'' || ''more'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=8| Oh, of course, because here it's eight hours ahead. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Cierto.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0076 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''certain'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| True. |- |}
[[Image:Wikimania2007 schedule check.jpg|thumb|'''el horario''' – the schedule|120px]] [[Image:Gnome_globe_current_event_3.svg‎ |thumb|'''el cambio de horario''' – the change of time zone|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''tener''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to have |- || '''(yo) tengo''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I have |- || '''el jet-lag''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the jet-lag |- || '''¿qué?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || what? |- || '''ser''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) es''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''ese/esa/eso''' || {{SbcPronoun}} ''(m./f./neuter)''|| this, that |- || '''el cambio''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the change |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''el horario''' || {{SbcNounM}}|| the schedule |- || '''ah''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || oh |- || '''claro''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || clearly, of course |- || '''porque''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || because |- || '''aquí''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || here |- || '''(ellos/ellas) son''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || they are |- || '''ocho''' || {{SbcNumber}} || eight |- || '''la hora''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the hour |- || '''las horas''' || {{SbcNounPF}} || the hours |- || '''más''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || more |- || '''cierto/cierta''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || certain, true |- || '''cierto''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || I think so |- |}
{{Wikipedia|taco}} {{Wikipedia|tequila}} ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''clarisimo''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || very clearly |- || '''el taco''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the taco |- || '''los tacos''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the tacos |- || '''el tequila''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the tequila |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''tener''' || {{SbcInf}} || to have |- |align="right"| '''(yo) tengo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I have |- |align="right"| '''(tú) tienes''' || || you have (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) tiene''' || || he/she(/it) has |- |align="right"| '''(usted) tiene''' || || you have (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) tenemos'''|| || we have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) tenéis'''|| || you have (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) tienen'''|| || they have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) tienen''' || || you have (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''ser''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) soy''' || {{SbcPT}}|| I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) eres''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) es''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) es''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) somos'''|| || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) sois'''|| || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) son'''|| || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) son''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- |}
{| |valign="top"| {| |- ||      |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''uno''' || 1 |- |align="right"| '''dos''' || 2 |- |align="right"| '''tres''' || 3 |- |align="right"| '''cuatro''' || 4 |- |align="right"| '''cinco''' || 5 |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''seis''' || 6 |- |align="right"| '''siete''' || 7 |- |align="right"| '''ocho''' || 8 |- |align="right"| '''nueve''' || 9 |- |align="right"| '''diez''' || 10 |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''once''' || 11 |- |align="right"| '''doce''' || 12 |- |align="right"| '''trece''' || 13 |- |align="right"| '''catorce''' || 14 |- |align="right"| '''quince''' || 15 |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''dieciséis''' || 16 |- |align="right"| '''diecisiete''' || 17 |- |align="right"| '''dieciocho''' || 18 |- |align="right"| '''diecinueve''' || 19 |- |align="right"| '''veinte''' || 20 |} |valign="top"| <noinclude>{{Listen|filename=SpanishNumbers.ogg|title=SpanishNumbers.ogg |description=the numbers from 1 to 20|format=[[Ogg]]}}</noinclude> |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Tengo jet-lag.''' | I have jet-lag. | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | What's that? | '''El cambio de horario.''' | The change of time zone. | '''Ah, claro, porque aquí son ocho horas más.''' | Oh, of course, because here it's eight hours ahead. | '''Cierto.''' | True. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Tengo jet-lag.''' | I have jet-lag. | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | What's that? | '''El cambio de horario.''' | The change of time zone. | '''Ah, claro, porque aquí son ocho horas más.''' | Oh, of course, because here it's eight hours ahead. | '''Cierto.''' | True. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | I have jet-lag. | '''Tengo jet-lag.''' | What's that? | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | The change of time zone. | '''El cambio de horario.''' | Oh, of course, because here it's eight hours ahead. | '''Ah, claro, porque aquí son ocho horas más.''' | True. | '''Cierto.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | I have jet-lag. | '''Tengo jet-lag.''' | What's that? | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | The change of time zone. | '''El cambio de horario.''' | Oh, of course, because here it's eight hours ahead. | '''Ah, claro, porque aquí son ocho horas más.''' | True. | '''Cierto.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | I have eight hours more. | '''Tengo ocho horas más.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | Because of ({{=}} '''por''') the change of time zone. | '''Por el cambio de horario.''' | What's that? | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | Here it's eight hours less ({{=}} '''menos'''). | '''Aquí son ocho horas menos.''' | True. | '''Cierto.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | I have eight hours more. | '''Tengo ocho horas más.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | Because of ({{=}} '''por''') the change of time zone. | '''Por el cambio de horario.''' | What's that? | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | Here it's eight hours less ({{=}} '''menos'''). | '''Aquí son ocho horas menos.''' | True. | '''Cierto.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | We have jet-lag. | '''Tenemos jet-lag.''' | What's that? | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | The change of time zone. | '''El cambio de horario.''' | Oh, of course, because here it's one ({{=}} '''una''') hour ahead. | '''Ah, claro, porque aquí es una hora más.''' | True. | '''Cierto.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | We have jet-lag. | '''Tenemos jet-lag.''' | What's that? | '''¿Qué es eso?''' | The change of time zone. | '''El cambio de horario.''' | Oh, of course, because here it's one ({{=}} '''una''') hour ahead. | '''Ah, claro, porque aquí es una hora más.''' | True. | '''Cierto.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.comment: /* Vaginal Cuff Dehiscence After Hysterectomy */ Overview
revision.text:
{{:Radiation_Oncology:TOC}}
<big>'''Vagina'''</big>
==Vaginal Cuff Dehiscence After Hysterectomy== *Rare event, reported at 0.1-0.3% after total hysterectomy **Total laparoscopic hysterectomy appears to have higher rate (~5%) than total abdominal hysterectomy (~0.1%) or total vaginal hysterectomy (~0.3%) *Predisposition **Premenopausal women: Vaginal cuff infections or wound hematomas **Post-menopausal women: Vaginal surgery for genital prolapse or complicated pelvic operations **High-grade enterocele, vaginal vault prolapse and severe cuff atrophy contribute to the weakening of the vaginal apex **Cuff radiation may compromise tissue vascularity and weaken the vaginal apex *Triggers **Physical triggers: Intercourse, other sexual practices, ''vaginal brachytherapy'' **Pressure triggers: Valsalva (coughing, straining to pass stool) **Spontaneous: Even many years after hysterectomy *Signs and symptoms **Pelvic pain **Vaginal bleeding **Egress of abdominal or pelvic viscera **A variety of other small-bowel symptoms **Severity of symptoms related to elapsed time between event and presentation *Extruded body parts **Small bowel (commonly distal/ terminal ileum) **Omentum **Appendix **Fallopian tube *Management **Fluid therapy **Wrapping the bowel with moist saline pads **Early antibiotic therapy **Surgical repair ***Vaginal, transabdominal, or combined approach ***Choice depends on bowel viability, the ability to reduce the prolapsed bowel, and the need for and extent of vaginal repair or reconstruction ***The decision to proceed with the definitive repair primarily or to delay until resolution of inflammation depends on the viability of the tissues
*'''Pittsburgh''' **'''2007''' (2000-2006) PMID 17478361 -- "Incidence and patient characteristics of vaginal cuff dehiscence after different modes of hysterectomies." (Hur HC, J Minim Invasive Gynecol. 2007 May-Jun;14(3):311-7.) ***Retrospective. 7286 hysterectomies (7039 total and 247 supracervical) performed by abdominal (TAH), vaginal (TVH), laparoscopic-assisted vaginal (LAVH), or laparoscopic hysterectomy (TLH) ***Outcome: vaginal cuff dehiscence after total hysterectomy 0.14% (10/7286). However, incidence 4.9% after total laparoscopic hysterectomy, 0.3% after total vaginal hysterectomy, and 0.1% after total abdominal hysterectomy ***Characteristics: median age 39 years, median time-to-dehiscence 11 weeks. 6/10 had both cuff dehiscence and bowel evisceration. 6/10 reported first post-op intercourse as the trigger event. 50% smoked cigarettes ***Conclusion: TLH may be associated with an increased risk of vaginal cuff dehiscence **'''1996''' PMID 8784315 -- "Vaginal evisceration: presentation and management in postmenopausal women." (Kowalski LD, J Am Coll Surg. 1996 Sep;183(3):225-9.) ***Retrospective. 3 cases. Literature review further 57 cases. ***Risk factors: postmenopausal 41/60 (68%), previous vaginal surgery (73%), presence of enterocele (63%). Most managed by primary repair, either immediately or delayed ***Conclusion: Vaginal evisceration seen with obstetrical or post-coital trauma, but in postmenopausal women also history of vaginal surgery and pelvic support disorder. Hypoestrogenism, atrophy, and devascularization from prior surgery seem to play a significant role
*'''Bologna; 2006''' (1995-2001) PMID 16154253 -- "Transvaginal evisceration after hysterectomy: is vaginal cuff closure associated with a reduced risk?" (Iaco PD, Eur J Obstet Gynecol Reprod Biol. 2006 Mar 1;125(1):134-8. Epub 2005 Sep 8.) **Retrospective. 3593 patients, treated with hysterectomy (63% abdominal, 33% vaginal, 4% laparoscopic). Closed cuff 40%, open cuff 60% **Outcome: vaginal evisceration in 0.3% (10/3593); no difference by route of surgery (abdominal 0.26% vs vaginal 0.25% vs laparoscopic 0.79%), no difference by type of vaginal cuff closure (closed 0.4% vs opened 0.2%) **Trigger event: intercourse 40%, application of vaginal cylinder 20%, spontaneously 40%. Mean time to evisceration 20 months (2-62 months) **Conclusion: In young patients, sexual intercourse is the main trigger event; in elderly patients, evisceration is a spontaneous event
*'''NHS; 2006''' (UK) PMID 17130054 -- "Vibrator in the peritoneal cavity: a case of post-hysterectomy vaginal vault evisceration." (Velchuru VR, J Obstet Gynaecol. 2006 Nov;26(8):826-7.) **Case report of an unusual presentation.
*'''Lille; 2003''' (France) PMID 12798729 -- "Vaginal evisceration after hysterectomy: the repair by a laparoscopic and vaginal approach with a omental flap." (Narducci F, Gynecol Oncol. 2003 Jun;89(3):549-51.) **Case report. 2 patients, 2nd patient with endometrial cancer IB, applicator for vaginal brachytherapy inserted through vaginal cuff with resulting small bowel evisceration
*'''1907''' No PMID -- "Rupture of the vaginal wall with protrusion of small intestines in a woman 63 years of age: Replacement, suture, recovery." (McGregor AN, J Obstet Gynaecol Br Emp 1907;11:252-8.) **Initial report

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=My Name Is ...|id=A0082}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} First contact! We learn how to say “hello” and how to introduce ourselves. And I think this is also one of the very first podcasts of the SpanishPod team. At least Leo seems to feel a bit uncomfortable in front of the mic. Well, there is always a first time. The keyword is '''llamarse''' – to call oneself. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0004|A0004: She's not Mexican]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0007|A0007: Where are you from?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0072|A0072: Here is my card]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=My name is...|id=A0082|dialogueid=A0082 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Hola! ¿Cómo te llamas?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y tú?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Yo soy Roberto.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Encantada.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mucho gusto.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Hola!''' || '''¿Cómo''' || '''te''' || '''llamas?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''hello'' || ''how'' || ''yourself'' || ''(you) call'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=4| Hi! What is your name? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Me''' || '''llamo''' || '''Antonia.''' || '''¿Y''' || '''tú?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''myself'' || ''(I) call'' || ''Antonia'' || ''and'' || ''you'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| My name is Antonia. And you? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Yo''' || '''soy''' || '''Roberto.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''I'' || ''am'' || ''Roberto'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| I'm Roberto. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Encantada.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''enchanted'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| Nice to meet you. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mucho''' || '''gusto.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0082 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''much'' || ''pleasure'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| It's a pleasure. |- |}
[[Image:Duerer01.jpg|thumb|'''me llamo Albertus''' – I call myself Albertus|120px]] [[Image:William Holmes Sullivan - The Fairy Ring; the Enchanted Piper.jpg|thumb|'''encantado/encantada''' – enchanted|120px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}:{| |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''hola''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || hello |- || '''¿cómo?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || how? |- || '''se''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || oneself |- || '''llamarse''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to call oneself |- || '''te''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || yourself (informal, singular) |- || '''(tú) te llamas''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you call yourself |- || '''me''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || myself |- || '''(yo) me llamo''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I call myself |- || '''y''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || and |- || '''tú''' || {{SbcSubjectPronoun}} || you |- || '''yo''' || {{SbcSubjectPronoun}} || I |- || '''ser''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(yo) soy''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I am |- || '''encantado/encantada''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || enchanted |- || '''mucho/mucha''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || much |- || '''el gusto''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the pleasure |- |}
{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''¿cuál?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || which?, what? |- || '''(él/ella) es''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''tu''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (informal, singular) |- || '''el nombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the name |- || '''¿Cuál es tu nombre?''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || What is your name? |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''me''' || {{SbcReflexivePronoun}} || myself |- |align="right"| '''te''' || || yourself (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || himself/herself(/itself) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || yourself (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos''' || || ourselves, each other |- |align="right"| '''os''' || || yourselves, each other (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || themselves, each other |- |align="right"| '''se''' || || yourselves, each other (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''llamarse'''|| {{SbcInf}} || to call oneself, to be called |- |align="right"| '''(yo) me llamo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I call myself |- |align="right"| '''(tú) te llamas''' || || you call yourself (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) se llama''' || || he/she(/it) calls himself/herself(/itself) |- |align="right"| '''(usted) se llama''' || || you call yourself (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) nos llamamos''' || || we call ourselves (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) os llamáis''' || || you call yourselves (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) se llaman''' || || they call themselves (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) se llaman''' || || you call yourselves (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''ser''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) soy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) eres''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) es''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) es''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) somos'''|| || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) sois'''|| || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) son'''|| || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) son''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¡Hola! ¿Cómo te llamas?''' | Hi! What is your name? | '''Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y tú?''' | My name is Antonia. And you? | '''Yo soy Roberto.''' | I'm Roberto. | '''Encantada.''' | Nice to meet you. | '''Mucho gusto.''' | It's a pleasure. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¡Hola! ¿Cómo te llamas?''' | Hi! What is your name? | '''Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y tú?''' | My name is Antonia. And you? | '''Yo soy Roberto.''' | I'm Roberto. | '''Encantada.''' | Nice to meet you. | '''Mucho gusto.''' | It's a pleasure. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Hi! What is your name? | '''¡Hola! ¿Cómo te llamas?''' | My name is Antonia. And you? | '''Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y tú?''' | I'm Roberto. | '''Yo soy Roberto.''' | Nice to meet you. | '''Encantada.''' | It's a pleasure. | '''Mucho gusto.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hi! What is your name? | '''¡Hola! ¿Cómo te llamas?''' | My name is Antonia. And you? | '''Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y tú?''' | I'm Roberto. | '''Yo soy Roberto.''' | Nice to meet you. | '''Encantada.''' | It's a pleasure. | '''Mucho gusto.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Hi! I'm Roberto. What's your name? | '''¡Hola! Yo soy Roberto. ¿Cómo te llamas?''' | Hi! My name is Antonia. And you? | '''¡Hola! Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y tú?''' | Roberto. My name is Roberto. It's a pleasure. | '''Roberto. Me llamo Roberto. Mucho gusto.''' | Nice to meet you. And what's your name? | '''Encantada. ¿Y cómo te llamas?''' | ROBERTO! | '''¡ROBERTO!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hi! I'm Roberto. What's your name? | '''¡Hola! Yo soy Roberto. ¿Cómo te llamas?''' | Hi! My name is Antonia. And you? | '''¡Hola! Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y tú?''' | Roberto. My name is Roberto. It's a pleasure. | '''Roberto. Me llamo Roberto. Mucho gusto.''' | Nice to meet you. And what's your name? | '''Encantada. ¿Y cómo te llamas?''' | ROBERTO! | '''¡ROBERTO!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Hi! What is your name? (formal) | '''¡Hola! ¿Cómo se llama?''' | My name is Antonia. And you? (formal) | '''Me llamo Antonia. ¿Y usted?''' | I'm Roberto. | '''Yo soy Roberto.''' | Nice to meet you. | '''Encantada.''' | It's a pleasure. | '''Mucho gusto.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Hi!
